Your politics are no concern of mine. Your Horde has disrespected the sanctity of this place. You are no longer welcome here - leave at once!
Give us time, Lord Zhu. Give us the opportunity to bring Hellscream to justice.

Sunwalker, I respect your people. You have aided us in our campaign against the Sha and the Thunder King. Otherwise, I would've already ordered the Shado-Pan to purge this entire shrine. But my patience is at an end. The Horde must leave.
Please. Give us time to make this right.
Taran Zhu stares grimly into the distance.
Very well. You have until season's end. No longer.
We pandaren are no strangers to dealing with tyrants. The coming battle will try your souls. May the celestials guide your actions.
Look at us three. Back to da sands of old Durotar! It be just like old times.
Not quite, old friend. Times have changed. The line between friend and foe is not so clear.
Dey come! Hellscream tink his own people gonna roll right over.
Time ta show dis Warchief da fury of da Darkspear!
Hold! Let dem run away. Hellscream will execute dem as cowards if they go back. Sen'jin Village is safe!
Regroup! We press da advantage. Before the Warchief fortifies Razor Hill, we take it for da revolution, an' close off da road to da Barrens.
Anyone who can still fight, come wit' me!
Wait Vol'jin. Horde is spilling Horde blood. It is tearing me apart.
We need ya, mon.
I know. I trust you to lead the siege. I am needed elsewhere.
I refuse to believe that all of my brethren support Garrosh.
You set one foot in Orgrimmar, Hellscream gonna bury a knife in ya neck!
I am going to Orgrimmar, alone. Eitrigg, Saurfang, surely they are standing against Garrosh. I must find others.
I won't hear ya say such tings.
It has to be said, Vol'jin. If we do not make it through this - I want you to know. You have always been my friend. My brother.
For da Horde.
For the Horde.
Darkspear, with me! We ride! No sleep 'til Orgrimmar!
My, you are strong! When I was young, I might have doubted that we could do this. But now, I have no doubts at all.
Such wind! Such cold! Once, it would have filled these old bones with despair. But on this day, I am filled with hope.
Heh, do not get angry with the elements. Violence is their nature. I conquered my own anger long, long ago.
Such a patient one! When I was young, I would have hated this task. Nowadays, I am filled with love.
Do not fear the heights, as I did when I was young. Fear can drive us to terrible deeds. Ah, but I see that like me, you have learned the lessons of courage!
Great Jade Serpent! Hear our plea.
My champion and I seek the blessing of your wisdom.
To do what is right, no matter the cost. That is wisdom.
When is it ever wise not to act for the greater good?
I shall tear this world apart!
%s hands you a climbing rope.
It is a risk I have to take. But if I am killed, please watch over Aggra and my boy.
Look mon, Alliance filth washed up from Theramore. Kill it!
The Jade Serpent is the incarnation of wisdom in Pandaria. Let's see what she has to say.
Intruders have been spotted! Defend the Thunder Forge!
The Thunder Forge is ours!  We will defend it with our lives!
I will meet you at each of the four shrines, champion.
Remember, we must visit all four, but we only need to complete ONE of the four challenges.
Choose the challenge most appropriate for your unique talents.
Good luck!
Tell me again about the King and the Council...
Text1_lang: Tell me again about the King and the Council...

Text_lang: Tell me again about the Warchief and the Darkness...
Text1_lang: Tell me again about the Warchief and the Darkness...

Text_lang: My work is not quite finished. This cloak will grant you the power of the celestials.
Very soon we will be able to augment your cloak with my own formidable draconic powers.
Continue to aid your allies in the war effort. I will contact you shortly!
Seer Hao Pham Roo hands you the end of his climbing rope. Tie it to the next Rope Anchor and help him up the mountain!
Will you help an old man retrace the steps of the last emperor?
I am ready to help you walk the path.
Text1_lang: I am ready to help you walk the path.

Text_lang: Zephyr increases your movement speed - share this effect with Seer Hao Pham Roo by walking beside him.
Text1_lang: Zephyr increases your movement speed - share this effect with Seer Hao Pham Roo by walking beside him.

Text_lang: Hatock, son of the Iron Wolf! I come for your head.
Hold still pup. At this range it wouldn't take much to pierce that armor.
Ga'nar, we caught Durotan's tracker.
More vermin come to infest our sacred grounds.
Durotan must have sent $Ghim:her; for a reason.
Bah. Let me show you what I think of my brother's "message".
Hold still demon. At this range it wouldn't take much to pierce that armor.
Ga'nar, we caught Durotan's green orc tracker that has been tracking us.
More corrupted filth. As if this scorpar infestation were not enough.
That green skin of yours marks you as the aberration you are. You are no more orc than the filth at the bottom of this pit.
Ga'nar's impatience could tear the Frostwolves apart. It is just like my brother to put his own needs above the clan.
Ga'nar! It is about time you returned. What grisly trophies are these?
I have slain the sons of the Iron Wolf. He drowns in the blood of his own.
Your fool crusade left us exposed to attack. Many died.
You are no Chieftain of mine, brother. By my rights as second son, by the justice I have dealt today, I declare mak'gora.
It has come to this.

Text1_lang: You must not do this! You are family!

Text_lang: Family looks to its own! Only I cared to avenge our father's death!
Vengeance neither feeds nor protects our clan. Do you not see why father chose me as his heir when our eldest brother went missing?
Father chose wrong. This clan needs strength!
End it.
Chieftain.
Her presence defiles Frostwolf honor. The other clans will spit upon us.
Those who cannot stand... deserve... to... die! [PH - Targets Draka and is about to charge.]
Vengeance does not make our clan strong.
Rise up, brother. I need you. This clan needs you.
The strength that comes from protecting the ones you love.
We are a family, Ga'nar. Family stands together.
THAT is what makes the Frostwolves strong.
Come stand with us, brother. Join your forces with us. There is much work to be done.
I lost? How could this be?
Yes, brother. I would welcome you with open arms.
Still alive, pup? I guess I won't have to save you after all. Come, we should talk.
I am proud, but I admit you bested me, brother. I wish to learn more of your strength. We shall rejoin you.
Give me money for cool things
Rifleman
Text1_lang: Rifleman

Text_lang: Your father MAY be able to identify what's left of your tiny skull.
Brothers! Today, we do what Durotan will not!
The scorpar are at bay and our mounts are ready, old friend.
Today, we take vengeance on the beast who killed Garad!
Welcome to Frostwind.
Magic Dude
Text1_lang: Magic Dude

Text_lang: AoE Dude
Text1_lang: AoE Dude

Text_lang: Snare Dude
Text1_lang: Snare Dude

Text_lang: Forward, brothers and sisters! Cut through the camp and rally at the Savage Crag!
Lok'tar ogar!
Lok'tar ogar!
Bro, my pet is going to incinerate you!
My menagerie will eat the flesh from your bones.
Then it is time.
As for you, outsider...
You'll ride the loaner. Hrah hah hah!
You have earned a place in this raid. And since you haven't yet bonded with a frostwolf of your own...
Let's see how you like the newest addition to the Warchief's arsenal... the Iron Star!
Oh, look. You're the ones that smashed up my Juggernaut.
Aggron! Show 'em who's boss!

Text1_lang: Drek'Thar! I don't know what you are doing up there but it is angering the goren to no end.
Be careful. This place is sacred, not safe. What I am about to do could get a lot of unwanted attention.
Great spirits of the wind, heed my call! Share with me the source of your pain.
I will try to use my totems to assist you if the need arises.

Text_lang: I came to ask the elements for aid in the coming battle.
But among the burning, biting winds of the mountains I heard the cry of the fury, Exurotus.
Beaten, half consumed, and shattered by ancient magics, the fury is the prisoner of the magnaron Kron.
The fury has been fragmented, its pieces scattered on the wind or consumed by scavengers.

Text1_lang: Wait $p! This way. Before the giant sees you.

Text_lang: Akama! Why not raze their town? Why give them another chance?
The word of an orc is garbage. They're only buying time.
Enough talk of battle, Hogo. Finally, Shadowmoon enjoys peace.
Or not.
MY EARS HURT!

Text1_lang: I hear a spirit. A powerful one! Keep those goren at bay for just a little longer.
Buy me just a few more moments.
Stay down, shaman. Catch your breath. This champion can forge ahead and we will catch up when you are ready.
Spirits of the wind, lend us your speed.
The Thunderlord are fools for the most part, but they understand combat with giants.
They are also notorious for etching down their favorite tactics on armbands. I assume they are either bragging or failing to remember.
Spirits save me but it is cold. My lungs feel like they are on fire.
There it is. The carcass. I... I don't think I can go with you in there. My arm will not stop shaking and it is as if the land itself is screaming in my mind.
I will see you on the inside, $p. Spirits guide you. Orgrock, lend me a hand if you will.
In here.

Text_lang: Our work is vital to the world.
Here! My champion arrives!
Ah, of course! My old friend from the Jade Forest!
Wait wait wait - let me make sure I get the story right.
Pandaren will tell this tale for generations!
It starts with a hero.
An outsider, from beyond the mists!
Conquering a strange new land!
Must we use the word, "Conquer?"
Venturing into forgotten vaults...
Mantid and mogu alike were brought low by the hero's fury.
Their power and wisdom seized for a greater glory!
When war came to Pandaria's shores, our hero was ready.
A faction standard-bearer, beloved by the people and feared by their foes.
Even the mighty Thunder King fell before our champion's might.
One by one the secrets of an ancient empire were laid bare.
Yes, knowledge uncovered for the benefit of the world.
POWER acquired for WAR and CONQUEST!
Let us stop for a moment - what kind of hero are we talking about?
An agent of destruction, forged by my will to forever change the face of Azeroth.
My friend, please think carefully about the legacy you will leave behind.
Behold! Latent titan power, imbued with my own draconic essence, tempered by the wisdom of the pandaren celestials.
Overwhleming power. Use it to heal or destroy! To protect or annihilate!
Come to me, champion! Collect your well-earned reward!
How will the story end?
There is only one way to find out.
A pandaren legend is born! Sing praises to our new hero, $n!
Nonsense. I had that handled. Cool as a cucumber.

Text1_lang: I knew it. You should've stayed back at the garrison, Archmage.

Text_lang: Tell my story...
Text1_lang: Tell my story...

Text_lang: I will crush it! (The Pale are the key.)
Unlike you, your minions are adorable.
I have been programmed to gloat.  Ha ha.  Ha ha.  Ha ha.
This is unfortunate.
How does that feel, $r?
If I had emotions, I still wouldn't feel sad about that.
Your minion has been terminated.
My olfactory sensors detect a burning odor.
Too bad.  Now for a real pet.
You'll pay for that.
An opportunity presents itself! I believe the Timeless Isle holds the key to unlocking the full potential of your cloak.
An island, lost in time, where the sun never sets. What could it mean?
Power! Glory! Loot!
...Ours for the taking! Hero, meet me at the Timeless Isle.
I should very much like to see this island for myself. Perhaps I will see you there?

Text1_lang: |cFFFF8040Ki the Assassin |r|cFF71D5FF|Hspell:145427|h[Kick]|h|r|cFFFF8040s the $n.|r
|cFFFF8040Kavan the Arcanist |r|cFF71D5FF|Hspell:145530|h[Counterspell]|h|r|cFFFF8040s the $n.|r

Text_lang: You are what you drink, $n -- I hope you have been drinking something strong.
You fought well, but your tactics are all wrong.  Have a drink and rethink them.
Look at this, I have been beaten!  I'm going to have to brew up some ideas for next time.
Why did he fight?  To die, apparently.
The wind blows in my favor.
A fortunate attack!
I knew that was coming.
Such a glorious defeat!
Rest for now, little friend.
Maybe, uh, maybe you're ready for a lesson in chaos?
You were so preoccupied with whether or not you could win, you didn't stop to think if you should.
Gee, the lack of humility before nature that's being displayed here, uh... staggers me.
What's so great about victory? It's a violent, penetrative act that scars what it explores. What you call victory... well, nevermind.
Dead?  Don't you mean extinct?
Your pet had its shot, and nature selected it for extinction.
I'm, I'm simply saying that life, uh... didn't find a way.
That's, that's chaos theory.
What have you got on that team of yours, King Mukla?
Dinos... dropping?  Dropping?
You now face Patience!  Wisdom!  Knowledge!  What virtues do you possess, $n?
Today you have lost -- but what have you learned?
You have taught me much, $r.  It seems the master has again become the student.
A worthy sacrifice.
The autumn leaves must fall to make room for spring blossoms.
Defeat is merely a lesson masked by disappointment.
Like the stream meeting the cliff, there is beauty in the fall, if you know where to look.
To die would be a wonderfully grand adventure.
When one virtue is lost, cling to those that remain.
A worthy sacrifice?

Text1_lang: Oh, I hope you like surprises.
You're lucky it was just your pets... this time.
In the Celestial Tournament, either you win or you die.
Take the right opponent out and it's all downhill from there.
Oh, was that one of your favorites?  My bad.
This is so easy it would be boring -- if it weren't so much fun.
You bastard, my pet may never walk again!
The things we love destroy us every time, $c, remember that.
Keep killing my pets and you may find a dash of poison in your drink tonight.
Fear cuts deeper than swords.

Text_lang: Yer lucky Gizmo couldn't be here, but I'll still wipe the floor with ye, $c.
That one's for you, Gizmo!
Ach, so much for being good with animals. Now how do these bandages work?
Ha!  That worked better than I thought!
Oh, sorry, that fella's gunna need some tender lovin' later.
Fer a moment there, I thought we were in trouble.
No! Not again!
Curse my dwarven luck!
Oi, you'll pay for that one you will!
Do not be fooled by their diminutive size, $n, they are disciplined and quick.
Impatience is the road to defeat, you must learn to master your timing.
It requires a cunning strategist indeed to defeat my monks.  Well done, $n.
Exactly as I had planned.
You lack the necessary discipline.
Can you survive with what remains?
He fought and died with honor.
Victory often requires sacrifice.
When one Shado-Pan falls, another steps forward to take his place.
As water cracks stone, so shall we be your undoing.
The rivers foretold of this triumph.
The rivers foretold of this defeat.
And so they are washed away with little trace of what once was.
The stone thinks itself unmovable until the ground is washed away beneath it.
Cleansed by the righteous waters!
My companion is dispersed.  She will flow back to me when the time is right.
The river does not stop from a single stone.
The ebbs and flows of battle are to be expected.
Dragons are dangerous at any size, as I'm sure you'll find out.
If I can win a battle like that, I may have a chance against the Celestials.
Well done, $n.  You picked your friends wisely and led them with honor.
As I warned you before, dragons are known for their deadly attacks.
Even the strongest ally can fall to draconic magic.
A glass cannon sometimes breaks before it can fire.
You have strength I didn't see at first.
An unexpected move.
It will be difficult to recover from such a loss.
Do not despair the damage that was done here.
A long time ago, this land was beset by the shadows of doubt, of fear, and hatred.
One by one, I overcame them - and buried them deep within the earth.
And there ... they remained.
For ten thousand years ... as the veil of mists kept Pandaria hidden from prying eyes.
When the Cataclysm struck, I decided the time had come to part the mists ... and help heal our broken world.
But as your war-fleets crashed upon our shores, all of my old doubts and fears rose up, to torment the land once again.
You triumphed over the darkness I had locked away.
You have shown Pandaria the power of a true hero.
But the question still remains... why do we fight?
Face your fears. Calm your hatreds.
Find peace within yourself, so that you may share it with the world around you.
These are the greatest treasures in life.
Surely they... are worth fighting for.
I have been apprising the lorewalker of your deeds, champion. Are you ready to hear your tale?
Dear Emperor. It is done. The darkness that you once struggled against has been purged from Pandaria - forever.
But the cost... such a terrible cost.
These outsiders have brought chaos to this land. Can we trust them to set it right?

Text1_lang: Gul'dan sends his best.

Text_lang: I trust you have learned: To fight out of fear or anger is to fight a war that never ends.
Hehehehahahaha!
Alright, boys. Let's show 'em how Blackfuse Company fights.
BEHOLD, MY GLORIOUS DESTINY!

Text1_lang: Sorry, vanishing!
I am sure they are trying, Kavan. Be nice.
Sooli, move!
Ah, our first enemy! Illusionary Rippers are but simple warriors. Now, let us do this!
Illusionary Flamecallers! Watch your feet, everyone. Do not stand in the lava.
I am down. Let us try again!
Oh no, did you forget to heal yourself?
The illusions will not hold back, this time. Their attacks will be relentless. Be prepared to use your strongest healing spells.

Text_lang: Oh dear. Speedy, help!
Huh? Ohhhh, ohhh!
Ahh, Illusionary Tunnelers! Speedy and I have faced these foes before. Beware, they may burrow into the ground and then suddenly pop up under a new target, and CHOMP! Hah ha hah ha.
Argh... please... take care... of Speedy!
There is no end in sight to these illusions, but we shall hold out as long as we can.
Hah ha! Wonderful job, everyone! Friend, see Rotun about beginning the next trial.
Long ago, the Jade Serpent instructed me to purify my spirit and become one with the land, my doubts were vanquished.
When my journey began, I was reckless in my strength. The White Tiger taught me control. My hatred, anger, and violence were vanquished.
The Red Crane saw hope in me, and instructed me to look inward. Despite my visage of despair, I found this hope, and the despair was vanquished.
In the face of great fear, the Black Ox taught me fortitude. Through terror and darkness it persevered. The fear was vanquished.
You have walked the trial of wisdom, and learned of the path of the Jade Serpent. May you learn from this lesson, as I did.
You have walked the trial of strength, and learned of the path of the White Tiger. May you remember this lesson, always.
You have walked the trial of hope, and learned of the path of the Red Crane. May it guide your footsteps through time.
You have walked the trial of fortitude, and learned of the path of the Black Ox. May it bless your passage.

Text1_lang: Help! Get these things off of me!
What are you standing in?! Get out of the fire!
Illusionary Rippers approaching. They should pose little challenge; they are but mindless grunts.
Prepare your defenses. That is an Illusionary Conqueror! When they become enraged, they gain great strength, and nothing can stop them.
A new enemy, Illusionary Flamecallers. They cast fireballs and spew lava. Use the lava to your advantage; it will burn the other illusions.
Beware! Illusionary Wind-Guards can use their wings to knock you back. When they do, they will likely switch to attacking me instead.
Illusionary Ambushers! Get their attention, quick. And get them away from me, so they cannot hit me with their devastating bananas!
Illusionary Foragers are attacking. Do not let their cute faces fool you. They can work together to cause terrible devastation.
Ahh, I cannot heal through that much damage! Did you forget to equip your heaviest armor?!
I am down. Maybe I should bring more healing herbs for next time.
Greetings. I am Sikari, master of jade lightning, chi, and healing mists. For this trial, you must protect me from the incoming illusions, while I heal you and dispatch our foes.
Greetings, again. Our next trial will be more challenging. Prepare to defend me.
Once again, you must defend me. Rotun, give us a challenge this time.
While our end is inevitable, let us try to take as many of them down with us as we can. Be ready.
Assassin!

Text_lang: Thank you... emperor. Thank you.

Text1_lang: Khadgar - someone's here!

Text_lang: Rest well, honored mother. You will be avenged.
Text1_lang: Rest well, honored mother. You will be avenged.

Text_lang: It's all fun and games until...
Eye, what are you looking at?
Razuun, you stay here. I have other plans for... what is that?
All I require is its limitless power.
It will be done, Lord Gul'dan.
You know what needs to be done, champion.
Meet me in the Veiled Stair when the deed is done - assuming you're still alive when this is over.

Text1_lang: Oi! That was a fun ride!
Heroes, I salute you. There's something right foul in these chambers below the city.
Ooh, that looks dangerous. Get in there, boys, and show em' what we're made of.
A right deadly machine, that is. Best watch yer step down here, heroes.

Text_lang: Oh, ho ho... Hey now. What do we have here?
So Garrosh thinks he can cheat ol' Grizzle out of a payday, huh?!
Go get it boys, that contraption's got nothin' on real goblin engineering!
Ahhhh! Or maybe it does. I better, um, go check on the others.
I like shorts! They're perfect for this weather!
Text1_lang: I like shorts! They're perfect for this weather!

Text_lang: Go easy on me!
Your pet fell down!
Awww! No fair!
Yay! I'm the best!
Rise, old friends. The time has come for the next step of my plan.
Teron'gor, infiltrate the Auchenai and take control of Auchindoun. Bleed them dry.
Cho'gall, we'll finish your Frostfire business together.
I'm sending you to Nagrand to subjugate the naaru in Oshu'gun.
Hellscream!
Your attack on Karabor was cowardly and unwarranted.
What's more, we thoroughly outclassed your orcs on the battlefield.
I would be within my rights to behead you and raze this town...
...but not today.  Today, we show mercy.  Pack up your machines of war and leave this place.
Teron'gor, we'll finish your Shadowmoon business together.
I'm sending you to Talador. Infiltrate the Auchenai. Take control of Auchindoun. Bleed it dry.
Cho'gall, I'm sending you to Nagrand.
You'll subjugate the fallen naaru inside Oshu'gun.
Giselda, you stay here. I have other plans for... what is behind me?
Send word to the rest of the pack: The sons of the Iron Wolf have been found. Lok'tar ogar!
My... father... will... avenge... me.
Your father will mourn, as I have mourned.

Text1_lang: The Iron Horde approaches. No sudden movements.
Throm-Ka, Commander Vorka. The Shadowmoon clan is honored by your presence.

Text_lang: Shaman, women... <spits>. I have no time for seers and mystics.
Where are your true warriors? Or, is what they say about the Shadowmoon true?
That you're a mass of cravens hiding behind your magic?
Step aside, brothers. We must speak with Hellscream.
No one may enter the city. Not even you, Shaman.
Text1_lang: No one may enter the city. Not even you, Shaman.

Text_lang: Thrall? Varok? What business do you have here?
Strength and Honor, General. We come to speak with Garrosh. There may yet be hope for peace.
But...
Text1_lang: But...

Text_lang: Kor'kron! You are needed at the front!
NOW!
You know I can make no guarantee of your safety... or Garrosh's response.
Lok'tar Ogar, brothers.

Text1_lang: Cravens? I'll show you craven!

Text_lang: Hold. I would not spill your blood today, Hara.
You Shadowmoon are proud and still have the warriors' spirit!

Text1_lang: <Narrows her eyes, but relaxes.>
Very well, Vorka, son of Vorash. The Shadowmoon clan will join this Iron Horde.
Lok-Regar. What orders?

Text_lang: Gather your clan. Soon the Iron Horde will crush Karabor once and for all!

Text1_lang: Zug-zug.
Our paths diverge here. Good luck, champion.

Text_lang: Hatock, son of the Iron Wolf! I come for your head.
Well look here boys, the mongrel son of Garad has returned from the grave.
Hrah hrah hrah! You should have stayed dead, Ga'nar. You would have lived longer.
Had Garrad just joined the Iron Horde like he was told you would still have your precious daddy to save you today.
Chose your last words carefully Hatock. There is no Thunderlord that can stand against me.
Yes, your wolves are very formidable in battle when in the open. But let us see how you do in the shadow of a gronn.
Thunderlord...  RELEASE THE BEAST!
Keep a grip on those chains.
His arm is loosening! Tighten that slack before he puts you all against a wall.
Put your backs into it!
We have a schedule to keep.
Hatock, son of the Iron Wolf! I come for your head.
What is wrong Ga'nar? Afraid of a bit of Gronn?
I thought you Frostwolves were supposed to be skilled?
Not so easy to fight a Thunderlord, is it?
You mongrels are no match for my blade!
If you had just joined the Iron Horde I wouldn't have to kill you now.
Hatock! You cannot hide from me!
Frostwolves! Fan out and harry the Thunderlord. For vengeance!
Honored brothers and sisters! Today we achieved what Durotan would not even dare to try.
Make no mistake. We are at war. And we need a Warchief!
Those of you bold enough to stand with me - come! We will show the world the might of the Frostwolves!
We... are... FROSTWOLVES!

Text1_lang: This is the Arbitum.
The Prophet foresaw a time in our future when our people would come into grave danger.
This shrine holds the power to save us from destruction.
I pray that the day of judgment shall never come. Power like this can only come at great cost.
Activation of The Arbitum requires an incredible amount of energy - energy of a kind that can't be found on this world.
Luckily, Iris Crystals do not originate from Draenor. We think three should be enough to supply the energy we need.
Five Iris Crystals have fallen from the skies around Shadowmoon Valley.
Unfortunately, it looks like the Shadowmoon are collecting them as well. We cannot allow them to succeed.
This is the Prophet's vision of what will come to pass.
Do you know the workings of our magic, traveler?
See this hammer? In my hands, it strikes with magical force against enemies. But used by an inexperienced trainee, it is no more than a blunt rock.
The Arbitum is only as powerful as the one who uses it.
In the right hands, it restores hope for this world. In the wrong ones, it is a weapon of absolute destruction.

Text_lang: Spirits of the water, I seek your guidance. Spirits of the earth, I seek your strength.
I... I hear the voice of a Fury!
Fly with me, hero. We will assist them from above!
The purifying light of the naaru is both our hammer AND shield.
They are at the very temple gates - fly closer! Hurry!
Circle back. We must clear the steps.
Exarch Akama! Watch your flanks!
Thank you, old friend!
Never again will you orcish hordes darken the light of Karabor!
Press onward. By the light of the Naaru!

Text1_lang: Watch out! Goren!

Text_lang: Spirits of fire, I seek ferocity- aaaaaah!
Hold, $p! This is not our enemy.

Text1_lang: Drek'Thar! $p, cover me.
Hear it faster! We are getting swarmed down here.
Let your wolf guide you Drek'Thar, and stay close to me if you can. $p, look for us in the Ice Forges when you are finished. Lok'tar ogar!
Rulkan was Ner'zhul's most trusted advisor for many years. Ner'zhul's strength and ambition guided our lives, but Rulkan's wisdom and vision inspired our spirits.
Ner'zhul's methods are brutal and direct. He cuts his enemies down by force.$B$BRulkan is clever and wise. She will turn an enemy's own blade against them.
The Shadowmoon Clan is no longer. Even if physical remnants remain, its spirit is corrupted.
We are here in self-exile. We refused to tap the magic of Ner'zhul's Dark Star.
It is unclear what will happen to us from here, but one thing is certain. My loyalty to Chieftess Rulkan is absolute.

Text_lang: Draka, help me up. We shou- hrraarh!
Do not forget, child, one of us is blind and unable to call upon the spirits like he used to.

Text1_lang: Bah! That should just come close to making it a fair fight. On your feet, old man.

Text_lang: What hope is there against a foe that can consume the very elements?

Text1_lang: You taught me long ago that the elements have always been there for us. Now it is our turn to be there for them. Victory or death, we owe it to them to try.

Text_lang: %s rumbles in assent.
$C! You have freed my children and made me whole. Accept my boon and bring the full fury of Frostfire to your enemies.
Shaman, you alone were strong enough to hear my call. You were wise enough to know what needed to be done. Give me your totem.
Feel the flames of the fury!

Exurotus was always believed to be a legend. A story told from shaman to shaman as a symbol of a true elemental spirit.$b$bTo see something so revered in shackles is an affront to orcs, to shamanism, and to me.
The stench of tortured stone fills the air, Draka. What do you see?
I can feel hundreds of goren burrowing through the earth. This will not be easy.

Text1_lang: Goren... lots of goren. We will distract them in order to sneak you into the Ice Forge.

Text_lang: What you suggest should be good enough to bring down a forger, but only for a few seconds at a time.
Spirits of the wind! Heed my call! We have need of your wisdom.
This is not a place Frostwolves tread. Be mindful of what shadows you step in.

Text1_lang: I am sworn by duty. If we are needed, we will be there. Come, Vindicators!
Hmmm... yes, you make a compelling point. Come, vindicators!

Text_lang: Come, child. Find safe refuge in my totem.
So many? Very well. When the Prophet calls, the rangari answer. Follow me, men! Velen requests our aid!
I place my trust in Velen's wisdom. He is, after all, the Prophet of my people. Follow me, men!
It is done? Good. Once this battle is over, we will have to begin repairing Karabor's proper shield defenses.
You are a friend of the anchorites, visitor. I will see you back at the rallying point.
Carry this symbol of my gratitude into battle, and its fire shall join with your own to burn your enemies to ash.
We are the only ones close enough to collect these pieces and unleash the fury.
Your security is lax, Chieftain. I caught these Rangari spies within your gates.
They are too late. The prisoners are already on their way to Anguish Fortress.
Their blood will summon forth the Dark Star, and make me as a God among the Iron Horde!
The Warchief honors deeds, not words, shadowcaster.
Seal the exits! No draenei scum leaves this village alive!
Thunderlord... I have failed you...

Text1_lang: Husband...

Text_lang: Enough! You scheming draenei can keep your precious temple... for now.
The Iron Horde will return!
I will move ahead and prepare a staging area for our counter-attack.
These orcs have violated the sanctity of Karabor. Their attack ends NOW!
May the Light guide our path!
Karabor ki'le!
Karabor ki'le!
Text1_lang: Karabor ki'le!

Text_lang: Arepheon! Provide us with cover fire!
Rangari! Arrows ready...
FIRE AT WILL!
Artificers, disable those tanks!
As you wish, Great Prophet.
Akama, Taalo! Show them the might of the draenei!
$n, you come with me.
Yes... Very good. Around Shadowmoon Valley are four arkonite crystals, ancient wreckage from our vessel.
I thought we would never need their power, but the time has come. Take my staff, and gather their energy for me.
All right, give me one moment...
There are still enemies among us. EVERYONE TO ARMS!
You must defeat Commander Vorka. There he is, at the very gates of Karabor.
With pleasure. Vindicators, follow me into the fray!
Furious little orcling!
In your blind rage you rush to face my ogres alone.
They will end you, little lone wolf.
Your conquered clan will fill my slave pens...
I'll drown you in the blood of your little army!
I will get these orcs to safety and meet with you outside.
Get me lose and I will speak with your wolf chief.
Let's go.
Text1_lang: Let's go.

Text_lang: I... feel... better! You've done the right thing! Now I shall go see what your wolf chief has to say.
The siege is broken! Come, brothers and sisters - drive these orcs from Karabor!
Karabor stands, for today.
You will not die today, champion!
Text1_lang: You will not die today, champion!

Text_lang: Let the Light heal your wounds!
Text1_lang: Let the Light heal your wounds!

Text_lang: The Light protects its champions.
Text1_lang: The Light protects its champions.

Text_lang: Thank you, $n. I will meet you back at Twilight Glade.
Text1_lang: Thank you, $n. I will meet you back at Twilight Glade.

Text_lang: Look! Fire!
Text1_lang: Look! Fire!

Text_lang: Aaauuughh!
Text1_lang: Aaauuughh!

Text_lang: No, Ga'nar. We are surrounded and exposed. We must fortify.
Reckless brother!
O're atal'sha! For the Light!
Text1_lang: O're atal'sha! For the Light!

Text_lang: We will not yield!
Text1_lang: We will not yield!

Text_lang: Forward! For Karabor!
Text1_lang: Forward! For Karabor!

Text_lang: There is much to be done. Taalo, see that the troops are healed and rested.

Text1_lang: Gah! He tried to stab me! I told you we couldn't trust the Laughing Skulls.

Text_lang: Limbflayer forgot to be nice. I saw pretty orc. I wanted to see if she could dance. Sorry. Sorry.
I have come to hunt the Iron Horde. I could destroy what remains of your ruined village, or perhaps we could assist one another.
Yes, wolves and skulls need each other. You need to know where the big Iron Hordy weapon is at. We need your $p.
You have proven yourself loyal to my clan. Capable of great things.
Our hold on Bladespire is tenuous, and some of my best warriors have raced off with my reckless brother.
I was impressed by your skill in our battle against Dorogg the Ruthless.
I would be honored if you continued to fight by our side.
I will block the temple against any more damage.
Go, $n. I will hold the temple gates!
Look out!

Text1_lang: Fan out! Leave nothing alive!

Text_lang: Let's get movin', then!
Lemme just get her warmed up...
Come on, baby girl...
There we go!
This way. There is a safe spot up ahead, just outside the Iron Horde's facilities.
I s'pose priority number one is to take care o' that nasty giant cannon.
Did somebody say "giant cannon"?
Soon enough. Our first priority is to find Yrel. She is out there somewhere.
D'kaan, you and our champion did some scouting earlier. What did you find?
...nothing conclusive, Vindicator.
I see. Well then, we will just have to...
I'll dispatch artificers to secure the crystals to the north.
And what of Ner'zhul? Will we let him take our people without retribution?
Patience, Maraad. A rescue will require planning - do not rush into danger until we know where our people are.
We made the wrong choice once before. I won't let it happen again. I can't leave our people to die.

Text1_lang: I will keep an eye on him, teacher.
When the Iron Horde came, they gave our clan a choice. Join them, or die.
My husband Ner'zhul chose to save our people. He joined the Iron Horde, but they asked of him a heavy price.
They said:
So Ner'zhul turned to the silent void. He broke the ancient laws, and drew upon the dark star.
I pleaded with him to stop, but he would not turn back.
By breaking this stone, he forswore all loyalty to our ancestors.
I can ask only one thing of you now, stranger.
You must do what I cannot. Stop Ner'zhul. End his madness before it is too late.
Good work, $p! Meet us at the rendezvous. Time to see how to drive this beast.

Text_lang: What good are stars and visions against steel and powder? Make a worthy offering, or your people shall die.

Text1_lang: The Shadowmoon fortress is sealed to outsiders, but this keystone will allow entry. Good luck, hero.

Text_lang: Ner'zhul! Your army is scattered, your fortress in ruins.
Your "dark star" has fallen, and now serves the draenei. You are a disgrace!
We would still serve the Iron Horde, Hellscream. Our magic is-
YOU HAVE NO PLACE IN MY IRON HORDE! Go back to your little village, Ner'zhul.  You can watch the stars while the Iron Tide washes over you.
Go back to your little village, Ner'zhul.  You can watch the stars while the Iron Tide washes over you.
Korhol, Zhakta, Trokar... move in from all sides. Gargrak, hold for now.
ZHAKTA NO!... you will be avenged!
Dammit all. Gargrak, go now... kill the blind shaman.
RETREAT! WE'LL BE BACK, FROSTWOLVES!
Kalandrios, I would like to witness the Ritual of Binding again.
Text1_lang: Kalandrios, I would like to witness the Ritual of Binding again.
Sorcerous coward.

Text_lang: The Iron Horde are moving toward the Temple of Karabor. The attack has beg--
Wait... what is that light?
Stand back!
It seems the elements of Draenor do not respond to me as they do on Azeroth...
Go on ahead. Durotan awaits. I must catch my breath.
To Bladespire! Attack!
There is no time to waste! We strike NOW!
Dorogg has fallen! Stay close, Frostwolves - the citadel is not yet ours.
Press the attack!
The Frostwolves will triumph.
This fortress will fall.
Do not give up!
Gather your strength!
Carry the light, brothers and sisters!
That was barely a scratch! I should recover quickly.
It is up to you, champion. I will stay here and help with the wounded slaves you rescued.

Text1_lang: Nothing worthwhile ever is.

Text_lang: Drek'Thar, old friend, you're alive!
I know your eyes don't work, shaman, but this one has green skin.
Hmph. Yes. Ga'nar is already causing trouble.
Very well, strangers. You have earned the trust of our shaman. I will not turn away the help.
I can barely stand. But for the actions of these heroes, I would be dead.
These are champions from a faraway realm, pledged to fight the Iron Horde.
I do not need eyes to see it; they are noble of heart. They saved our kin -- including your brother.
Come, friends. If you wish to fight with our clan, we welcome you to receive our blessings.
Reach out to the Shamanstone. Embrace the wisdom of this land and the ancestors that came before us.
Warriors! Today the tide turns.
We will claim Bladespire Citadel as our own.
Fight as one. We win this - together!
Ga'nar is a great fighter, but he is impatient. He has taken some of our best warriors with him.
He never listens. His ruthlessness may cost us.
Here - Gormaul Tower. This will be our foothold. Leave none alive! LOK'TAR OGAR!
The Bladespire ogres threw me into that hellhole. I'll notch my axe with their skulls until vengeance is mine!
Bladespire Citadel! I will have my vengeance on those ogres, even if I have to tear it down stone by stone.
My friends, you have earned a hero's welcome. Follow us to the Frostwolf Chieftain.
My eyes may not work, but the familiar chill of the air is comforting.
Ah yes. Garad's youngest: a noble soul named Durotan.
Wise beyond his years, but still young. I fear he has been thrust into the Gronn's jaws - our people are in great danger.
You mentioned the Frostwolf Chieftain...
Durotan!

Text1_lang: Fomic ore is tougher than hardened steel. You will need my goren-toothed pick axe to cut through the rock.
The spirits were kind to guide you to me at this moment.
It is done! The blade is forged.
You now stand before Na'Shra! Weaponsmith of the Frostwolf Clan. For your service, I give you mine.

Text_lang: You are hurt. Your flesh is pale.
The battle is joined. Lok-Narash!
Reinforcements approach. Attack!
The stench of a boar beast. Beware its tusks... Charge!
The tower is ours! Regroup and press on!
I will ride ahead. Frostwolves, hold the tower. Igrimar, with me!
I will forestall any counterattacks by the enemy. Lok'tar ogar!
Stand down, Warlord. It is over.
...Fenris?
No slave fights with the will of one who is free.
The Thunderlords retreat! They are making their way through Thunder Pass to the Iron Horde.
They are going to retaliate. We must be ready.
What is this...?
No, I will never be okay with this.
Come! To Thunder Pass. We are outnumbered 50 to 1. They don't stand a chance!
Thank you, child. I can always count on you.
There! Is this what you seek, Prophet?

Text1_lang: Kron approaches! Champion, with me.

Text_lang: If I try to release Exurotus it is sure to bring Kron down on us.
We have company, Master.
Tagar, deal with the intruder.
Frostwolves! The Iron Horde is coming. As we speak, they march on Thunder Pass.
But the Frostwolf clan is reunited! Together, we can protect this land!
Lok-Narash, Frostwolves! Prepare for battle!
You know me, brother. I'm always ready to fight.
Hold your position, Frostwolves! Let them come to you!
Axes up! Here they come again!
We can't fight with this cannon fire coming down. Thrall! $p! Take care of that tank!
Drek'Thar's in trouble. Ga'nar, get out there and lend him a hand.
You go too, $p.  Make sure my brother doesn't get himself killed.
Fall back! Prepare for the next attack!
Spears incoming! Hold your ground!
Hero, approach my totem for aid!
I'll be waiting.
Frostwolves! Stand strong! The battle is nearly done!
Drek'Thar! How much time do you need?
We are counting on you, shaman!
I do. Something big is coming.
GRONN!
All Frostwolves - charge ahead! Take that thing down!
Draka, make your way to the cave the scout spotted. I will meet the commander at the coastal village.
Champion, we will meet you ahead when you are done with your mission.

Text1_lang: Lead it away from Drek'Thar!

Text_lang: Exurotus is too weak. The most I can do is free him of his bonds. Death will claim him shortly afterward.
If I were stronger...

Text1_lang: There must be something you can do.

Text_lang: The fury is dying. We don't have much time.
There might be something. Exurotus, I offer my spirit as host to your own. Join with me, so that your fire may not be quenched.
MY SPIRIT... BURNS!

Text1_lang: Drek'Thar, what has it done to you?

Text_lang: He has become one with the fury. Their spirits are now merged.
I... I can see. I can see the shift of the elements, the movement of the spirits through the land. It is glorious.
The ogres will suffer for what they've done!
We will secure our borders!
Text1_lang: We will secure our borders!

Text_lang: Flowers?! Noooooo!
Please... no flowers...
Not me! Not now!
Not like this...
The legends are true!
Anything but flowers!
Flowers?

Text1_lang: So the wolves have come to play with the skulls? I will speak with Durotan but I will not hold out hope. His wolves are soft and lack conviction.

Text_lang: Ahhh!!!!! Finish it! Just let me die!
No excuses, Kor'gall. We are at WAR with another world. Motivate your people, get a mining pick yourself, I do not care. You WILL meet your quota or find your clan the target of our next weapon test.
Here, let me make some adjustments.
There ya go.
Durotan? Draka? What are YOU doing here?
Orgrim Doomhammer! You will be made to answer for your attack on my people!
Stay your hand, hero. I want him alive.
I have not forgotten or forgiven that. But Orgrim was once an honorable orc, and my closest friend. I owe it to him to at least try to help him regain some of his honor.
Always sentimental, Durotan. I am as loyal to my people as you are to yours. Do not presume that I walk this path willingly. Some things are more important than honor.

Text1_lang: Husband? It was his forces that killed your brother.

Text_lang: So much for subtlety. Those Laughing Skull are going to get us all killed.
Hmph. I remember ogre architecture being more formidable.
I issued no such order. I wanted your people to join us and protect this world from the threat of those beyond the portal.
You are my vanguard.
These shores are ours!
Leave no enemy alive!
Iron will, iron blood.
Go forth to victory!
Not long ago, we were orcs of many clans, quibbling over scraps in a world that was ours for the taking.
Now, as one clan, no enemy can hope to stand against the Iron Horde!
We will crush their bones beneath our boots.  We will burn their cities to ash!
The iron tide washes over them!
The doom that is coming will destroy us all. These outsiders will bring a wave of fire and death down upon us if the orcs do not act as one to destroy them first.

Because I have witnessed it! Every night! Every night for many months now. My dreams become nightmares, and in those nightmares I watch helplessly as the land corrupts beneath our feet and the sky is turned to fire.
Say what you will, but this is the doom that is coming. And it is these creatures from beyond the portal that will bring it.
And how can you be so certain of such a fate?

Text1_lang: I have never known the great Doomhammer to be afraid of anything.

Text_lang: Cho'gall! I sent you here to enslave this thing.

Text1_lang: Yes! Let us free ALL of the skulls! Remind them how to laugh! Burn all of the slavers to ash and ruin!

Text_lang: SKULLS!
Text1_lang: SKULLS!

Text_lang: Aaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhh! Ha ha ha!
Fire! Fire! Waa-aaaaaa! Ha!
Hero, meet us at Twilight Glade. We must save the prisoners.

Text1_lang: Burn burn burn burn torch and burn and cinder and burn and FIRE!

Text_lang: Thank you, champion. I have always felt my fate and that of the Dark Star are intertwined.
Light. Pure light. Hope in times of despair, brightness in our darkest hour!
Ner'zhul's ritual... begins! We are out of time!
We must stop the Shadowmoon Chieftain.
What needs to be done, child.
Hurry, champion. I will get there as soon as I can.
Do whatever you can to delay Ner'zhul...

Text1_lang: Prophet! What have you done to yourself!?

Text_lang: LAUGHING SKULL! LAUGHING SKULL! HAHAHAHAHA!

Text1_lang: LAUGHING SKULL! LAUGHING SKULL! HAHAHAHAHA!

Text_lang: This forest is ours!
Yrel! We will spill some orcish blood...
I am your Chieftain; you and your warriors will fall back in line.
OUR - FATHER - would BE - ASHAMED - of WHAT - YOU'VE - BECOME!
Our strength comes from working together.
[PH] Temporary cut-scene with my brother? Let's do it!
Yrel, walk with us a moment...
I... already told you... all that I know...
The Iron Horde will not hesitate to use that cannon on our base. We should find a more tactical location.
Is everyone alright?
I think I soiled m'self...
My ALE was back there...
Yes, everyone appears to be alright.
Very well. We will set up camp ahead, and deal with this cannon.
Yrel will have to wait.
Everybody in the Tank. Yrel is being held as a slave in the Stonemaul ogres' slave camp.
Yrel might already be free if it weren't for the actions of one deceitful rangari.
I did what I thought was right, Vindicator. The missing girl seems to be distracting you from our mission.
Yeah, what's so special about this girl anyway?
I lost her once. I will not lose her again.
Now THAT'S somethin' I can get behind.
Besides, the ogres're sellin' slaves to the Iron Horde. Stoppin' ta beat 'em up fer a bit is well within the scope o' our mission.
You all is gonna get smashed.
Oh no, ogre, that's where you have it wrong. You see, we are the ones that will be doing the smashing today. Thaelin?
Aye aye, cap'n!
Now is our chance! Forward, Thaelin, with speed!
What da...?
Stay silent, all of you! Ogre, if you so much as GRUNT, I will personally beat the Light out of you.
We can set up over there.
Ok'mokk didn't make no sounds at all. You don' need ta smash Ok'mokk.
Ach, I have a feelin' yer gonna get smashed anyway.
A direct attack. A bold decision.
Gathering allies. Wise decision.
Form up, everyone. We are headed to Smokebelcher Depot.
Form up, everyone. We are headed to the Planteau. [TEMP NAME]

Text1_lang: Room for one more on that elekk?

Text_lang: Always, my love.
Yrel, did you learn anything about the Goliath Cannon before your capture?

Text1_lang: A bit. The one you destroyed was merely a prototype. The actual cannons are built in the foundry, to the north.
I overheard one of the orcish leaders discussing a plan to use them on Shattrath.

Text_lang: Shattrath? Ha! Even that big ol' hunk o' metal couldn't hit Shattrath from here.
They could if it was loaded onta' a boat.
I suspected the same thing. They must plan to load the cannons onto barges at the Naval Base, in the northeast.
Our small group would never survive an attack on the Naval Base. Too fortified.
We will continue attacking their supply lines.

Text1_lang: D'kaan, how long have you been scouting out here in Gorgrond?

Text_lang: A very long time. Longer than you've been alive, probably by two or threefold.
D'ye get lonely?
A rangari who is not lonely is not doing his job.
Sounds like a crap job to me. Life ain't worth livin' if y'don't have lads and a lass t'come home to.

Text1_lang: Do you have a wife, Hansel?

Text_lang: Ach... the Blackrocks took 'er away.
That's half o'why I'm here: ta look after Thaelin, and ta get me wife back.
We will find your wife, Hansel. And we will leave a wake of bodies behind us. The orcs will pay with blood for what they did to our families.
Y'know, that's the darkest, coldest, most inspirin' thing I've ever heard from the lips of a paladin.
Our work here is done. Next, we head to Smokebelcher Depot.
Our work here is done. Next, we head to the Planteau.

Text1_lang: Thaelin, are you doing alright in there?

Text_lang: Quite fine, ma'am. Just happy to be out o' combat and back in me Tank.

Text1_lang: <sigh> This land is plagued by war. Do you think you'll return to the safety of home after our mission is done?

Text_lang: I dunno how much you've heard about Azeroth, ma'am, but we've got our fair share of war, too.
Once I've found me Ellie, I know I'll be headed back ta Searin' Gorge.
What about you, lassie? Will ye go home?

Text1_lang: With Velen gone, I feel like I don't have a home anymore.

Text_lang: We are draenei, Yrel. Being without a home is in our nature.

Text1_lang: I was thinking I might go through the portal with you, my love.

Text_lang: Yes, Yrel. You will have a home on Azeroth.
But first, we will make these orcs suffer for what they did to you. Their sins cannot be forgiven.

Text1_lang: Maraad, you're frightening me.

Text_lang: The Iron Horde's supply lines are now cut, however temporarily. We have forged our alliance with the Shapers.
There will never be a better time than this. Let us head to the Naval Base and exact our vengeance on the Iron Horde!

Text1_lang: What is our plan, Maraad?

Text_lang: We will slay as many of the vile things as we can. We will burn their homes and show them fear.
I will make them feel the pain I felt when I lost you, Yrel.

Text1_lang: Maraad... I am honored...
...but perhaps you are taking your vengeance too far. Have you forgotten what the Prophet taught us?

Text_lang: The prophet is DEAD, Yrel. Look what his teachings did for him.
Ye've gone too far, Maraad.
The Light's left ye. Even I can see that.
I carry no particular love for the Light, but I agree. You need to remember what you stand for, Vindicator.
Are any of you more holy than me? I am the LEADER of this expedition, and I will not be questioned any further!
The Light has not left me, Thaelin. No... the Light has finally shown me its true form.
Vengeance.
I saw the naaru's vengeance in the Purge of Grommar. I was there as K'ara herself unleashed holy death upon the filthy hordes.
[UNUSED]

Text1_lang: Maraad, my love. That's enough.

Text_lang: Yrel...

Text1_lang: You have been through too much, Maraad. Your thirst for vengeance will only lead to our death.
[UNUSED]
Rest now. I will lead our attack on the Naval Base.

Text_lang: I'm with you, Yrel.
I, too, will follow you.
And I.
Very well.
Thank you, Yrel. I don't know what's coming over me.
It is no matter. These souls are mine. My power grows.
Auchindoun will be mine! I will devour every last soul and bathe the ashes in hellfire!

Text1_lang: Yes, Tuulani. Now you see.
Your efforts were valiant. I did not think the anchorites could power the defenses with only one of the crystals.
But nothing will stop my plan, nor that of my masters. And the only things in our way...
Protector! Destroy these intruders!

Text_lang: Run for your lives!
Text1_lang: Run for your lives!

Text_lang: Wow! Thanks! I can find my way out of here now. I'm sure I won't get captured again. See ya!
I fear that even with the Heart intact, Auchindoun's defenses may not be enough. The Shadow Council has eyes everywhere.

Text1_lang: Mother?
Confound these wards! No matter how much I call upon the light to purge them it is as if the wards themselves thwart my ability to unmake them.

Text_lang: The runes have been destroyed.
Text1_lang: The runes have been destroyed.

Text_lang: Ready to face Revaan?
Text1_lang: Ready to face Revaan?

Text_lang: Child! Leave now. Those wards were there for your protection. You should not be here.
Yes. And she will never be yours.

Text1_lang: Tuulani, go to Telmor and meet with Soulbinder Aedraa. She has retrieved the final fragment and brought it there.
Right away.

Text_lang: De slaves are ready for ye boss.
Good, their wretched spirits will serve me better than their weak bodies ever could!
Hush, you idiot!
Ahhhh... Yes, now the Soulgrinder hums with power! With this, we shall be unstoppable!

Text1_lang: Looks like there's only one way out, hero. UP!

Text_lang: You do not understand the Great Work.
You cannot defy the Great Work.
This is the way of things. You cannot stop it.
You do not understand... You cannot know...
Yay! We unstoppable! We unstoppable!
I must return to the spirit world to continue my research. Guard this room and make sure that NO ONE touches the portal!
Come forth, Soulgrinder! Devour the souls that we have brought for you!
Axes down, brothers! Don't you recognize your own clan?
We are home.

Text1_lang: What do you make of it, Thrall?

Text_lang: It reeks of hatred and dust, Choluna. I don't like having it here at the garrison.
I'd like it even less in the hands of the Iron Horde.
We should destroy it.
Perhaps. First, we must find out what purpose it serves for Blackhand.
Choluna, step up our operation in Gorgrond. Whatever the Iron Horde are planning, I want to be ready.
And what are you supposed to be?
Amazing.
This is Frostwolf territory, but you may claim this plateau as your own. Consider it a reward for rescuing my people.
Thank you, chieftain. We will establish a foothold immediately.
Even our wyverns are not prepared for this type of cold.
Text1_lang: Even our wyverns are not prepared for this type of cold.

Text_lang: It looks as though we will not have allies in the skies for this one.
Text1_lang: It looks as though we will not have allies in the skies for this one.

Text_lang: We are going to have to find a better way to shield our wyvern from the cold.
Text1_lang: We are going to have to find a better way to shield our wyvern from the cold.

Text_lang: It would seem we need to rely on the local rylak for air travel.
Text1_lang: It would seem we need to rely on the local rylak for air travel.

Text_lang: Nope.
What do you make of it, Yrel?

Text1_lang: It reeks of hatred and dust, Omnuron. I don't like this.

Text_lang: We should destroy it.
This terrain is ideal for a stronghold.
I can open up a portal to Orgrimmar only briefly. Reinforcements are standing by, I hope?
The very best.
Somebody call for a fixer?
... You're entrusting a goblin to be your foreman?
Gazlowe, here, oversaw the construction of Orgrimmar.
Orgrimmar! The impenetrable fortress!
Wasn't it recently sacked?
Yeah yeah, okay, one little sacking.
Omnuron, step up our operation in Gorgrond. Whatever the Iron Horde are planning, I want to be ready.
What is this -- Wise-ear! You are alive!
Lead us to Durotan, old friend.
Wor'gol is the winter home of the Frostwolf Clan.
Durotan walks a cliff's edge, pinned between the Thunderlord orcs and Bladespire ogres.
Ga'nar seemed bent on dealing out retribution to both.
Ah yes! I worry about Durotan's brother. Always quick to fight. His need for vengeance will make him more reckless than ever.
What is THAT? I see a fortress of stone!
Bladespire Citadel. Once a far-flung outpost of the ogre empire.
If our people are to have any hope to survive, we must rout the ogres from their stronghold.
This is Durotan's goal. He will not ask for it, but we will need your help!

Text1_lang: Ga'nar did not wait for the muster call. His blood burns too hot.
Go! Win us a great victory. Tell my husband I will defend the town until he returns.
The Legion won't give up so easily. Auchindoun is too valuable to them.
Teron'gor! The Light comes for you!

Text_lang: The Legion will not stop here. They desire Auchindoun too much.
Nyami. Tuulani. We ride for Light's Rest immediately.
The vanguard is falling. We will not let their great sacrifice be in vain!
Your sacrifices will not be forgotten, Netherwane.
Archmage, let me stay behind. It was my sworn duty to watch over this portal.
I shared that duty with you, Dar'toon.  We will meet the enemy together.
They will sing songs of your heroism, Dar'toon.
Just get me free, stranger. I could kill a hundred of these pigs with this shovel alone.
Prepare to heroically CTRL-E through the portal with me!

Text1_lang: I'll lead the wounded to safety. Cover our escape!

Text_lang: Whoever you are... thank you.
Text1_lang: Whoever you are... thank you.

Text_lang: They were bleeding us dry. I don't think we had much longer...
Text1_lang: They were bleeding us dry. I don't think we had much longer...

Text_lang: Whoever you are... thank you.
Text1_lang: Whoever you are... thank you.

Text_lang: They were bleeding us dry. I don't think we had much longer...
Text1_lang: They were bleeding us dry. I don't think we had much longer...

Text_lang: Help us!
Text1_lang: Help us!

Text_lang: Set us free!
Text1_lang: Set us free!

Text_lang: Is anybody out there?
Text1_lang: Is anybody out there?

Text_lang: Help! Anybody!
Text1_lang: Help! Anybody!
$p, I think you should follow Tuulani and protect her. We need to ensure the crystal reaches Auchindoun safely.

Text_lang: $p, you should follow Tuulani and protect her. We must ensure the crystal reaches Auchindoun safely.
Blessings to you, stranger. Because of you, I will see daylight once more.

Text1_lang: Thank you, stranger! I was supposed to be their next meal...
Thank you, hero. I can fight my way out of here on my own.

Text_lang: We must deny Teron'gor entrance to Auchindoun. Come, let us meet at Retribution Point and discuss how to bring the fight to the enemy.
You have *cough* restored this dying orc's honor, champion. Farewell. And farewell, Snowpaw, my old friend...

Text1_lang: Thank you, hero. Your deeds will be remembered.

Text_lang: I've seen enough here.
Kargath, you coward!
You wouldn't last ten seconds against me, draenei.
You sound afraid, Kargath.
Two on one? Now, you speak my language!
That's not very sportsmanlike, Bladefist. Why don't we settle this in the arena?
Hold everything! Now, they speak my language!
But I'm afraid you're not much more than a warm-up, draenei. Doesn't anyone else feel like dying today?
Thought you'd never ask.
Return to Khadgar, champion! We will buy you the time you need!
I feel the flames dying down. What is happening, exarch?
We have a visitor. Perhaps... a savior.
We are freed! Follow me, shaman. We will escape through the hills.
He is right. The Iron Horde will move against us. We must be ready.
No, I will never be okay with this.
He made his choice.
You take care of the lieutenants, champion. Bladefist is mine.
Cutting down unarmed prisoners? Why not fight a real battle?

Text1_lang: Master Velen, I have never led soldiers before. Are you sure--

Text_lang: You are capable of more than you know, Yrel.
Now go. The Rangari follow your orders. Find the prisoners.
Just be ready when our ships arrive at Karabor.

Text1_lang: Nyami! We are here -
What is this? Oh, no... no...
You have to stop them!
...The protector... still answers her call... you'll have to defeat it!
Ahhh!
Are YOU, Tuulani, and your outsider friends.
Try as you might, this place is doomed. It is only a matter of time...
Yes! Yes! The crystal hums... just a bit of focus and...

Text_lang: Look out behind you!
Text1_lang: Look out behind you!

Text_lang: I think I got him.
Text1_lang: I think I got him.

Text_lang: You have my thanks.
Text1_lang: You have my thanks.

Text_lang: Praise the Light!
Text1_lang: Praise the Light!

Text_lang: A weapon!
Text1_lang: A weapon!

Text_lang: Now, let's see how THEY like being cut open!
Text1_lang: Now, let's see how THEY like being cut open!

Text_lang: At last, freedom!
Text1_lang: At last, freedom!

Text_lang: Farewell, my love.
Text1_lang: Farewell, my love.

Text_lang: Thank the Light!
Text1_lang: Thank the Light!

Text_lang: I thought I was going to die here.
Text1_lang: I thought I was going to die here.

Text_lang: You have no idea how long I've been waiting to do this.
Text1_lang: You have no idea how long I've been waiting to do this.

Text_lang: Die, pig!
Text1_lang: Die, pig!

Text_lang: I will avenge you, Tannosh.
Text1_lang: I will avenge you, Tannosh.

Text_lang: Go with the Light, sister.
Text1_lang: Go with the Light, sister.

Text_lang: May your spirit find rest with those of your people's ancestors.
Text1_lang: May your spirit find rest with those of your people's ancestors.

Text_lang: Kill them. Kill them all.
Text1_lang: Kill them. Kill them all.

Text_lang: Make them suffer, like I suffered.
Text1_lang: Make them suffer, like I suffered.

Text_lang: Thanks.
Text1_lang: Thanks.

Text_lang: I've never held a weapon before.
Text1_lang: I've never held a weapon before.

Text_lang: It feels good.
Text1_lang: It feels good.

Text_lang: Ooh!
Text1_lang: Ooh!

Text_lang: You give my people hope, stranger.
Text1_lang: You give my people hope, stranger.

Text_lang: Dagg tanks you, friend! <Dagg lets out a guttural chuckle.>
Dunno how dem orcs keep catchin' me. <Dagg snickers disarmingly.>
Hi again.

Gonna have to ask demself, "Did Dagg get catched or did Dagg catched dem?"

Big hero been blowin' Dagg's cover! But you special, Dagg t'inks. Dagg is master of dis guys and want to join you.

Dagg is unanimous in dis.
Unanimously agree with Dagg? (Garrison Follower)
Text1_lang: Unanimously agree with Dagg? (Garrison Follower)

Text_lang: Don' blow Dagg's cover!$B$BDey never question a tree.$B$BDagg is unanimous in dis.

Don' let dem see us talkin'!

Dey never question a two-head.

Dagg is unanimous in dis.
Shh! Act natural.
Shh! Don' blow my cover.
I am afraid I must depart and rejoin our pack at Wor'gol. Aka'Magosh.
Out of the way, peon!
Text1_lang: Out of the way, peon!

Text_lang: This acolyte and I will retrieve the rest of our group. Do everything in your power to stop that orc from opening that portal!

Text1_lang: We will return with help.

Text_lang: No... NO! This cannot be the fate of my people!
Ner'zhul leads us to this destiny. To save Karabor, we must stop him.
Meet me back at Twilight Glade, champion. We have much to do.
Good people of Fort Wrynn, our commander has finalized construction on a new building!
We're going to need to work together to get it up to full production. See to it our commander is not kept waiting!
Yo everybody, listen up. Thanks to our commander we got a new building up!
We gotta get this new structure up to snuff pronto, alright? Get to it yesterday!
You can handle things from here, I'm sure. Well done!
You won't be needin' me, you're in charge after all.

Text1_lang: I'll take this draenei back to Khadgar. Stop that orc from opening that portal!
We will return with help.

Text_lang: Power fluctuator active. Rebooting core systems. Please wait.
Alright, Pleasure-Bot 8000. Get back to work!
Command unrecognized. Will only accept commands from Pleasure-Bot 8000 owner: $p.
Damn it all, I give up. $p, you can have him! I'm done!
Alright, Pleasure-Bot 8000. Execute command X47G5!
That's it, I've had it! $p, you can have him! I'm going back to tank-building from here on out!
Ah, sweet freedom! You won't regret this, commander. I'll make you the finest armaments in all of Draenor!
Let's see what we have to work with.
The forge is the soul of the foundry. This one's small but with the right equipment I can enhance it.
These look good, with some modifications I should be able to load them into the cannons for a burst shot.
Shhh! Don't let dem see us talkin' or you'll blow my cover!
I'll see if I can get this thing goin'. Khadgar, buy me some time!
We will do what we can, Thaelin.
$n, keep these orcs off of us!

Text1_lang: Tank coming over the rise! Look out!

Text_lang: These controls don't make SENSE. Remind me never ta drive a tank built by an orc.
Hold strong, everyone. Here they come!
They're bringin' up explosives! $n, destroy those carts before they get close!
There's so many of them...
Don't you give up yet, paladin.
That's it! I've got 'er runnin'! Let's finish this.
Ahh ha ha haaa! Nice shot!
Very well, but don't take long. I will require both of you later, and you will need to be alive.
Come, Cordana!
I am forming a small party to scout the enemy's fortifications.
Text1_lang: I am forming a small party to scout the enemy's fortifications.

Text_lang: Thrall, take command of the remaining survivors and meet us up ahead.
Text1_lang: Thrall, take command of the remaining survivors and meet us up ahead.

Text_lang: Maraad, take command of the remaining survivors and meet us up ahead.
Text1_lang: Maraad, take command of the remaining survivors and meet us up ahead.

Text_lang: It will be done.
Yes, Archmage.
Up ahead! Look at that!
Ancestors help us... look at that!
I know what I must do.
BLOOD AND HONOR!
KILROGG DEADEYE
Text1_lang: KILROGG DEADEYE

Text_lang: WARLORD OF THE BLEEDING HOLLOW
Text1_lang: WARLORD OF THE BLEEDING HOLLOW

Text_lang: Look what dragged itself through my jungle. Fresh meat!
We won't go without a fight, Deadeye.
It looks like you could use a hand.
No! Fight me instead!
GOOOO... FIND... KHADGARRRR....

Text1_lang: Yay! Thank you thank you thank you SO much!

Text_lang: I thought everyone forgot about me. Thank you, $Gkind mister:kind lady;!
Wow, did you fight off all the orcs? You're strong!

Text1_lang: <The little girl wails inconsolably.>

Text_lang: With luck, the small ones will now flee, and we can begin construction.
We won't go without a fight, Deadeye.
Mm.
This slaver and torturer knows nothing of honor.
We cannot hide here forever.
Step into my arena and die with honor.
You have entered my arena, strangers. You will either leave it as victors, or as corpses.
Such is the way of the SHATTERED HAND.
A combat arena. This may be a trap, but at least we will die with honor.

Text1_lang: Hurry, Yrel. Your hammer's might will help us greatly.

Text_lang: I'll move forward and scout their gates while you're taking out those catapults. Lok'tar ogar!
Commander, Over here!
Damn these ogres and their magic! I can't find a way to bring the barrier down so we're just going to have to sneak in around it.
I'll go first and clear the way, meet me on the other side.
Blood and thunder, what a battle!
Let's kill some ogres!
Fly with me, hero. We will assist them from above!
The purifying light of the naaru is both our hammer AND shield.
They are at the very temple gates - fly closer! Hurry!
Circle back. We must clear the steps.
Exarch Akama! Watch your flanks!
Thank you, old friend!
Never again will you orcish hordes darken the light of Karabor!
Press onward. By the light of the naaru!
Carry the light, brothers and sisters!
We've done all we can from up here...
We did it! We broke the blockade!
We've broken the main siege. We should meet with our forces on the ground.
These are the last of our forces. We'll stay here to hold the temple gates.
Champion, I need you to fight your way to the harbor.

Text1_lang: I'll approach the enemy from the south. Light of the naaru, guide you.
Champion, the naaru has come to aid us. We must defend it while it gathers power!
We've done it! Now to put an end to this assault...

Text_lang: Witness the TRUE power of the Iron Horde!
ENOUGH. Play time is over. I will deal with you myself.

Text1_lang: Up there! The fleet commander shows himself.
What is the naaru doing?

Text_lang: It is done. Victory is ours!

Text1_lang: Hero, you fought fearlessly. For that, please accept my thanks.

Text_lang: Greetings, savior of my people!
If you are hearing this message, it means that I am no more - but Karabor is safe.
I owe you an explanation.
The naaru that we draenei revere are creatures of pure light.
But if their death is near, they lose their essence, collapsing into creatures of shadow.
When we draenei first arrived on this world, naaru accompanied us. But they could not stop our vessel from crashing.
The "Dark Star" that appeared in the skies above Draenor that terrible night was no celestial body.
It was a fallen naaru, ejected from our vessel in moments of panic and terror. Its name was K'ara.
What was once a creature of faith and beauty became a dark and hungering God, a living font of darkness.
We owed K'ara a great debt. Without the naaru's aid, my people would never have escaped our homeworld of Argus.
To see K'ara's transformation into shadow was a heavy burden to bear. When the naaru returned to us... I did what I had to do.
Remember, life is the light, and light is life itself. They may be exchanged, but nothing is ever lost.
Darkness... comes...
The shadows grow closer!
The Dark Star approaches...
The void will consume all...
Tank ya, mon. Dese Warsong be trixie an' got de drop on ol' J'wan.
I'm off ta Samedi's realm. I be seein' ya.
WARLORD BLACKHAND
Text1_lang: WARLORD BLACKHAND

Text_lang: LEADER OF THE BLACKROCK ORCS
Text1_lang: LEADER OF THE BLACKROCK ORCS

Text_lang: I 'preciate da blessin', mon. De Lord of de Grave smile upon ya.
Dey's someting in Oshu'gun pullin' on me soul. I gonna hava look.
What dis? I be dead!
I gonna haunt dese Warsong foreva. Stay away from de voodoo.
AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!
Text1_lang: AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!

Text_lang: Furies of the Throne of Elements, we answer your call. How may we serve?
Commander! When I heard the ogre's death cry I came as soon as I could. Did everything go well?
Someone call for a lift?
You three! Follow $p onto the battlefield, and listen for my call.
I have a plan.
And the Raven Mother spoke to me: Krikka, you are my dear child. You shall seek out my other wayward children and bring them back to the nest.
When all of the flock have gathered the end shall come. The world will be torn asunder in a great catastrophe! Fear not, for the Raven Mother will save us!
The Raven Mother will come from the heavens for her children. We will rise upon her great ebon wings to take our rightful place in her dark kingdom!
Until that time comes give your praise to the Raven Mother! Look after her great kin for guidance and strength. May she cast her shadow upon you!
Scribe! Did you get all of that?
Yes, High Ravenspeaker.
Praise the Raven Mother!
With the keystone, you will be able to pass through, alone. Once inside, deactivate their shields and we will join you.

Text1_lang: Ared would not want to see me standing here crying like this. Let's go to this armory of yours.
This looks amazing! If only Ared was alive to see this, he would be so proud!

Text_lang: The docks. Run to the docks. Run. RUN!
Come at me, Hellscream!
Don't be a fool, Ga'nar - Run! We will fight another day.

Text1_lang: Look out!
Keep moving. I see the ships ahead.

Text_lang: Their entire army is behind us.

Text1_lang: Their entire army is behind us.

Text_lang: Where now?
Head for the ships at the end of the road.
This way. Go, go, go!
There is no place to run, outsiders. This is MY world. We will find you!
We Frostwolves will be waiting for you, Hellscream! You, your ogres, your whole Iron Horde... You're as good as dead!
Ignore his threats. We will go to Shadowmoon for reinforcements. This time, the draenei will triumph.
Let's get underway then. We will need to build a stronghold if we hope to end the Iron Horde threat. And we're going to need help from the natives.
To Shadowmoon!
To the home of the Frostwolves!

Text1_lang: I'll move forward and scout their gates while you're taking out those catapults. Dioniss aca.
Commander, over here!
That magical barrier is too strong for our explosives to break open. I can't find a way to bring it down so we're going to have to sneak in around it.
I'll go first and clear the way, meet me on the other side.

Text_lang: That danged army should be here any minute. Let's move!
Personnel evacuation system engaged.

Text1_lang: By the light, what a battle!
Lets do this!

Text_lang: That was close.
There is no turning back. We press on, through the very jaws of the beast.
Who knew the draenei held such... delicious treasures in their temple?
Do you dare challenge me, defenders of Auchindoun?!
Sever my bonds... and the portal falls...
Such decadence... it will all burn.
Yes... Yes!
Grommash will pay for his arrogance.
The legion comes for you.... We will feast on these souls.
Do not delay, mortal. I can feel the life-essence of your armies fading. There will be time for regret later...
We will meet again... $n.
Gul'dan, such foolishness. This gift... so much more than you could ever know....
Long have I waited...
...hungered... to be more...
And now, all shall bow before me!
The bonds weaken. Freedom will be mine!
Everyone - find cover!

Text1_lang: Giving away our position. The fool brought a genesaur down on us.

Text_lang: What do we have here? A hero? Gorgrond is no place for heroes, my friend.
They fired on Veil Akraz!
It's just... gone...
Come, we must go!
Free at last.
I swear, by the spirit of my father, I WILL MAKE THEM PAY.
Gah!
Ugh - oh!
Well now.
I'd say we made an impact.
Looks like we arrived just in time.
Free at last! Join me in the ogre mound when you are done, and we shall slay the ogre chieftain together.
Bring them to me alive, Roltall. They will fetch an excellent price.
The Iron Horde have landed upon these shores. It is our task to make them regret it.
In here!
We cannot stay here long. Soon, the entirety of the Iron Horde will be upon us.
$n, our champion, will stay back and disrupt the enemy camp. The rest of us will seek safe passage through the jungle.
Good luck, $n.
Fight well, $n.
AAAAAAHHHHHHHHHH!

Text1_lang: Exarch, have your soulbinders meet me at my camp. I intend to stop Teron'gor before he unleashes more demons.

Text_lang: We must stop Teron'gor before this world falls... as so many others have.
Don't worry, $n. We've got your back!

Text1_lang: Come on, we need to get going pronto!

Text_lang: Here you are, miss Pinchwhistle!

Text1_lang: About time! Come on, Gazwitz.
Of course, ma'am.
Supervising of course. Now, get moving!

Text_lang: Well done, $n.
This cave will serve us well.
Follow me, and stay close.
Now - kill your hundred, or die trying!
Sorry, but we don't have that kind of time.
Hmph. I only counted ninety-nine kills, wizard.
Then I guess we owe you one.
Everyone, with me!
Quickly! Into the cave, before they thaw.
We've done all we can from up here...
After them! Don't let them get away!
I am pleased. I could watch you rats fight for hours.
Exarch Maladaar, take Qiana with you and scout the cave.
As you wish.
$n - I have a special job for you.
Lady Liadrin, take Olin with you and scout the cave.

Text1_lang: At your command.

Text_lang: Your scurrying is at an end, rats.
Not so fast, Ner'zhul.
Yes... step closer! I will bury you alive for the glory of the Iron Horde!
Worthless...
I've seen it in my dreams... these strangers from other worlds would burn everything we've fought for.
But it is orc blood that runs in the veins of Draenor!
Go forth, Iron Horde!  Make corpses of our enemies.
For the glory of Grommash!
Where is my power, ogre?
Your power? (It's MY power!)
You will obey, disciple. Hand over its reins.
I think not. (We're done taking orders from you!)
We've learned much from K'ure. (We're writing a book.)
You're insane.
Run away, old man. (Soon Highmaul will burn. Then, the world!)
In death... I am free...
Those Iron cowards were using us as conduits to power their portal. They will regret that.
The Shadow Council thanks you.
Seek out Gul'dan if you truly wish to stop the Iron Horde. (Gul'dan! Gul'dan powers the portal!)
Gul'dan! Gul'dan powers the portal!
I admit, even in Socrethar's madness, there was a hint of truth.
He questioned our complacency. Perhaps we have been too content, too SAFE, hiding here on Draenor.
A call is coming, hero. I feel it, large and looming, just beyond the horizon. When the time  comes, the draenei must answer.

Text1_lang: Today, we have defeated one of Gul'dan's strongest allies.
Without their leader, the Sargerei will crumble. The Auchenai will soon be able to reclaim their city.
For now, we can consider this a monumental victory. Thank you, hero.

Text_lang: Our only course of action is to retreat. Everyone, with me!
Cho'gall!
Guards! Stop him!
Seal the gates! Protect the palace! Highmaul will never fall to the likes you.
You thought to imprison us, Mar'gok? (You could never control us!)
Destroy them all. Raze this city to the ground! (The stones will be ours! All shall fall to darkness!)
Operations in Tanaan go well. The Citadel is almost complete.
I am keeping a close eye on the Highmaul ogres, Warchief. So far, they remain... obedient.
What of you, Blackhand?
Alliance and Horde forces strike at the Foundry, but they are nothing I cannot handle.
Again, Blackhand? All I hear are excuses.
Azuka! How goes the search for the alpha?

Text1_lang: Well, Warchief. We need only the Heart of Gorgorek to give it life.

Text_lang: Good. I will have you deal with the other-worlders as well. Or... do you lack the bloodlust of your forefathers?

Text1_lang: My blade skills surpass those of my sires, Warchief. I can clean up Blackhand's mess.

Text_lang: Hrahh... I will slice off your tongue for that!
Ahahaha... bold words from my newest Warlord. Very well!
Carry forth your ancestral blade. Bathe it in the blood of our enemies. Show me its legendary power.
Prove yourself, Azuka, and I shall esteem you among my Warlords.

Text1_lang: Don't worry, little mouse. I haven't forgotten about you. I'll take care of you... later.

Text_lang: Hang tight, $Gsir:my lady;. I'm here to help you.
Don't worry about me. I know my way around here.
I'll poke around here. See if you can find anything elsewhere in the camp.
What do you know about Grommash Hellscream's plans?
Text1_lang: What do you know about Grommash Hellscream's plans?

Text_lang: Grommash Hellscream met with his Warlords - Blackhand, Kargath Bladefist, Kilrogg Deadeye, and Azuka Bladefury. I'd watch out for Azuka... it seems she is charged with destroying the Alliance forces here on Draenor.

<Written on a nearby piece of paper:$B$BWe have uncovered Gorgorek the Worldrender, an ancient magnaron frozen in the stone pools of Gorgrond.$B$BThe Warsong elders believe this magnaron was a once-powerful alpha, with the ability to command lesser beings of its own kind.$B$BAncient clan records suggest that the beast can be awakened.>
Text1_lang: <Written on a nearby piece of paper:$B$BWe have uncovered Gorgorek the Worldrender, an ancient magnaron frozen in the stone pools of Gorgrond.$B$BThe Warsong elders believe this magnaron was a once-powerful alpha, with the ability to command lesser beings of its own kind.$B$BAncient clan records suggest that the beast can be awakened.>

Text_lang: <Scraps of paper surround the map of Blackrock Foundry. They look like manufacturing orders for war machines.>
Text1_lang: <Scraps of paper surround the map of Blackrock Foundry. They look like manufacturing orders for war machines.>
