Text_lang: Is it not wonderful to see so many others who are excited about banking?
Text1_lang: Is it not wonderful to see so many others who are excited about banking?

Text_lang: Numernormi chuckles.
Text1_lang: Numernormi chuckles.

Text_lang: Well that's silly. Banking is fun!
Text1_lang: Well that's silly. Banking is fun!

Text_lang: For the Hoard!
Text1_lang: For the Hoard!

Text_lang: Aeoreon sighs.
Text1_lang: Aeoreon sighs.

Text_lang: Quickly, friend! This will be my smelliest concoction yet, if you can help me gather ingredients for the pot!
Text1_lang: Quickly, friend! This will be my smelliest concoction yet, if you can help me gather ingredients for the pot!

Text_lang: Bah! Those moths know a good a thing when they smell it! Help! Keep them off me!
Text1_lang: Bah! Those moths know a good a thing when they smell it! Help! Keep them off me!

Text_lang: Fascinating! How far have these items traveled through those currents? Just how many more tunnels lay beneath our own feet, unseen, unknown?

Text1_lang: Mixing stuff together is my favorite thing to do ever!
The bubbles make it pleasantly fizzy--very nice!
Well look at that! Aerated potions, how ingenious!
And there we go! Mistie's Mana Mist! See what wonders we can conjure when we work together?
Mix this with this and...

Text_lang: Marvelous! And I never even had to leave my desk!
Hi! It's Rannan! Take my invention and use it on the refti here. It should knock out their toxic brain fog and get them back to fixing the titan tech in the area!
My mind. I can think clearly again!
Text1_lang: My mind. I can think clearly again!

Text_lang: Ah-ha! My theory was correct! With some refti maintenance, the area will go back to normal--whatever normal is.

Text1_lang:
A lot of trainers, they go into snail racing shiny eyed and slimy tailed. They don't know the hard truths. 

Harder than a snail's shell, it is.

Snails are very versatile creatures. You can race 'em. You can eat 'em.

Huh. Well, that's about it.

Text_lang: The shadowflame infusing the caldera has begun to coalesce here. Disperse it before it can spread beyond the lava!
The djaradin elders are warlords of great cruelty. Killing them will not be easy, but we must strike them down!
The Zaqali have built up defenses around their awakened elders. Take them out!

Text1_lang: The only pest here is you, Vakan.
Feel the heat!

Text_lang: Shadows burn.

Text1_lang: A glorious eruption.

Text_lang: Growing darkness.
Succumb to your final twilight!

Text1_lang: I will dance in your ashes!

Text_lang: You possess the ferocity of a flickering candle, Gholna.

Text1_lang: I am... extinguished.

Text_lang: Blistering gloom.
I see... Shadowlands arena... fight forever...

Text1_lang: Race... you... there...

Text_lang: The Elders have fallen! And with their deaths, countless dragon lives are saved and avenged.

Text1_lang: Do you see, Vakan? These insects do not even notice you.

Text_lang: They're just focused on an easy kill, Gholna.
The Zaqali use our flight's armaments in their rituals. Reclaim them, and show them what those weapons are truly capable of!
These djaradin underestimate us. They will regret it.
We cannot remove this corruption, but we must keep it at bay. Good work.
Well done. The more we thin them out, the closer we get to breaking their foothold here.

Text1_lang: The local mineral pools have gotten out of balance and it's driving the elementals mad. Get things back to neutral so they'll stop with all that commotion!
Finally, it smells like things have calmed down!

Text_lang: These misguided fools may be beyond saving, but their equipment is not. Gather what you can to arm our own forces.
These will serve the true black dragonflight well.

Text1_lang: Oh, you know just how nasty and confrontational those deepflayers can be, don't you? Soon they'll be swarming over Loamm unless someone clears out that cave.
There you go, uplander. We appreciate you making sure the deepflayer's range doesn't reach Loamm. We don't need them scenting up the town and devouring everyone.

Text_lang: No, Big Bessie! It's goin'ta be okay, darlin'. Please, someone help!
Text1_lang: No, Big Bessie! It's goin'ta be okay, darlin'. Please, someone help!

Text_lang: Yes, it's done! Delicious! Thank you, friends!
Text1_lang: Yes, it's done! Delicious! Thank you, friends!
Come and get your ice-cold ancheevies! They're right on the snow behind me. Grab a bunch!

Text_lang:
Well, look at you! I love your look!

You travelers all have such interesting gear. Such shiny sparkly gear!

I wouldn't mind having some fine sparkly stuff, myself. My ottuks love them, too! Say, if you can bring me something particularly shiny, perhaps I could let one of 'em travel with ya.
Text1_lang:
Well, look at you! I love your look!

You travelers all have such interesting gear. Such shiny sparkly gear!

I wouldn't mind having some fine sparkly stuff, myself. My ottuks love them, too! Say, if you can bring me something particularly shiny, perhaps I could let one of 'em travel with ya.

Text_lang: Then one day, the sky grew dark with the wings of dragons.
Text1_lang: Then one day, the sky grew dark with the wings of dragons.

Text_lang: The two travelled together from one end of the isles to the other, both insisting they were heading the same way of their own accord, yet taking great pleasure in the other's company.
Text1_lang: The two travelled together from one end of the isles to the other, both insisting they were heading the same way of their own accord, yet taking great pleasure in the other's company.

Text_lang: "I am sorry," said the stranger sadly. "I must go. We are called." And in a flash of cerulean, the stranger transformed. Tusks grew to fangs, hands to claws, and skin to bright blue scales!
Text1_lang: "I am sorry," said the stranger sadly. "I must go. We are called." And in a flash of cerulean, the stranger transformed. Tusks grew to fangs, hands to claws, and skin to bright blue scales!

Text_lang: Hanuuqa stared... and then reached out a hand to place it gently on the dragon's shining scales. "Take me with you." She whispered.
Text1_lang: Hanuuqa stared... and then reached out a hand to place it gently on the dragon's shining scales. "Take me with you." She whispered.

Text_lang: The stranger smiled, and the two were never seen on the Dragon Isles again.
Text1_lang: The stranger smiled, and the two were never seen on the Dragon Isles again.
Have you come to hear a tale, traveler?

Text_lang:
Welcome, friend. How can we help you?

The Valdrakken Accord is pleased to see the dracthyr return to the Reach. The dragons are expanding their influence again, and they spread their wings wide.

I just hope we can piece together the mysteries of the dracthyr's past.

Text1_lang: Want to follow the path of Iskaaran fishing?

Text_lang: We need to be quick, quick, quick. There are a lot of people--and things--that don't want us here!
Interesting. We must take samples. I wish we had a sample from Aberrus to compare it to.
Well, I dunno about dragon script, but that's in line with our ancient stories. The great black dragon would use this platform to test his monsters.

Text1_lang: Yeah! They would force the monsters through the caustic pools! You can smell all these icky containers here. The elders told us all about the beastly things they did!

Text_lang: More like so a bunch of stuffy people will give me money. My research is good for everyone, but it's expensive. I need grants, so I have to look good to the expeditionary committee.
Well, I originally came out here to work alone... but also for SCIENCE! I want to bring back something cool that I'll be remembered for.
Oh, that sounds like a noble thing, Rannan. We are glad to help you! And... we'll get famous too for all the things we sniff out!

Text1_lang: Oh! I think I get it... Is it so the uplander young ones will know and respect you?

Text_lang: So, Rannan... Why do you come to dangerous places like this?
Wonderful! Let's all get famous! You in Loamm for the smells you discover, and me on the surface for the discoveries I make!
It is no small effort to manage the trade and crafters of a city like Valdrakken, but it is also very fulfilling. How can I assist you today?

Text1_lang: But it is sometimes best to admire things from the sky.
%s takes a gentle breath in.
The rivers in this land are wonderful.
I am sure you took amazing photographs. I cannot wait to see them.
The pictures aren't just smooth, they are FLUFFY!

Text_lang:
Greetings, dragonrider!

Are you here for the Flowing Forest Flight course?

This course's path takes you through the enchanting Flowing Forest, the Shifting Sands, and past the imposing Temporal Conflux.

Would you like to fly this course?
Text1_lang:
Greetings, dragonrider!

Are you here for the Flowing Forest Flight course?

This course's path takes you through the enchanting Flowing Forest, the Shifting Sands, and past the imposing Temporal Conflux.

Would you like to fly this course?

Text_lang: Living water, bring them death!

Text1_lang: You feed their souls to their brethren?  You are sick.

Text_lang: Things that make you go... BOOM!

Text1_lang: Don't think for a moment you could beat me. My pets are unstoppable.

Text_lang: Can you stand on the tallest peak, winds and sleet buffeting your skin, until the trees wither and the mountains fall into the sea?
We shall see.
You are the mountain, unmovable by all but time.
Though you will be surrounded by foes greater than you can imagine, your fortitude shall allow you to endure. Remember this in the times ahead.
When faced with challenges the like you have never seen, what do you hope for? What is the future you seek?
Then let us begin.
Without hope, there is no brightness in the future!
Create the destiny you seek!
Your hope shines brightly, and even more brightly when you work together to overcome. It will ever light your way in even the darkest of places.

It is wonderful to see you again, $n. 

Considering what we witnessed in the Acidbite Ravine, the mood here is quite buoyant. 

I am sure it is not just my tea, but as they say: every little helps!
Squawk?
Hermit Yarren knows the best sniffing mice. I bet if you borrow one from him, you'll be able to find some good smellies!
I do not think it is the djaradin specifically... more their artifacts and how they deal with the elements.
He's the expert. All I know is it might mean a breakthrough we can use in the "upland" as you call it.
Actually, that might be it. His people live deep in the heart of a volcano surrounded by lava. They are close to the elements of fire and earth similar to the djaradin.
Why? Is it because he smells of a volcano as well?
The Sundered Flame? Again? Don't they know we're doing important sciencey stuff? Deal with their patrols so we can keep working!
Whoa, whatever you did really riled up the native wildlife. Get back to the hub--fast!
Welcome to my inn, weary traveler. What can I do for you?
Text1_lang: Welcome to my inn, weary traveler. What can I do for you?
But $n, undaunted, promptly killed it and cooked it into the most delicious of soups, nourishing their family for weeks!
A mighty shark, with dorsal fins like mountains and teeth the size of mammoth tusks!
One day, the notorious fisher $n thought of the new best way to catch fish - by standing on their head! For three days they remained in this pose, until finally they caught...
Then, furious, the creature drew a mighty weapon, a spear the size of a storm cloud! It waved it in the air, threatening to strike the hero down!

Text_lang: By Gral, that's a mighty fine catch you've got there!
Text1_lang: By Gral, that's a mighty fine catch you've got there!

Text_lang: Only the best for you, Unpiat.
Text1_lang: Only the best for you, Unpiat.

Text_lang: Hmph, we'll see about that. Your last few have been less than impressive.
Text1_lang: Hmph, we'll see about that. Your last few have been less than impressive.

Text_lang: Big catch for you today, Luko!
Text1_lang: Big catch for you today, Luko!
You'll pay for your tongue.
END IT! NOW! Before he can...
You think we will find anyone here who can help our efforts in de Azure Span?

Text_lang: I'm sure an adventurer will come by. This place should be crawling with them!
Well met, $c. What can I do for you?

Excellent. Being a unique professional is a gift, $p. To be the best at one thing...

It is a wonderful power, but also a responsibility: to your guild, to your customers, and to all of Azeroth. You must be true to your calling, fair in your business, and respectful in your trade.

Will you keep the integrity of a skilled professional?

<Miguel lets out a long sigh.>

Alright, alright, I get it. Just don't be rude to people, okay?

There are many ways to hone your craft in specialization. Sometimes you will gain insight from questing to help others, or discovering the wonders of the world, or even by accomplishing great feats and achievements.

One reliable way to practice your craft is to make something for the first time; this will always grant specialized knowledge. Another is to study the Draconic Treatises of your profession. Reading these treatises written by skilled scribes will surely lend insights.

Have you any further questions?
Ask away!

Text1_lang:
First, make sure you are a good representative of the Artisan's Consortium and be courteous to your customers!

Second, in order to be fair to the other crafters of the consortium, you can only fill a number of public orders per day.

But we want to be on top of the customers' needs, so if an order is about to expire, we won't count that against your limit!

Well, what are you standing around for? Go craft, craft, craft and be courteous, courteous, courteous!

Head to your crafting station and check for Crafting Orders!

Text_lang:
An excellent question! Lately, I have been taking in the wonderful sights of these plains.

When I explore the unknown and hidden paths, I sometimes find treasures of wisdom that inspire me to craft in ways I never thought of before.

There is a marvelous vista nearby. I encourage you to venture out and see its beauty for yourself. Perhaps you too will find insight there.
You can find Khadin in the far northwest of these plains. Surely they will have wisdom to teach you.

Text1_lang: Zzzzzzzzzz...

Text_lang: These two have climbed the ranks with a string of technical knockouts.  Because technically they have put all their challengers into a coma with the power of the Emerald Dream.
My patron has already fallen under the spell of the Twin Dreamers! Round four! FIGHT!

Teach you? Bah, you adventurers all think you deserve everything handed to you.

What I have learned, I earned over many years of honing my craft. It is only right that you do the same, or at the very least, prove yourself competent enough to deserve tutelage.
Return having slain your mark or do not return at all. I teach only those who commit to their craft.
You can probably find Jimothy browsing the shops on the lower level. Put in a good word for me!

They say that a profession is easy to learn but difficult to master.

At first, you will specialize very quickly, discovering new ways to hone your craft every day.

But eventually, you will have to work much harder to find something new to learn. Don't give up, because you will ultimately be able to learn all there is to know about a specialization should you choose to do so.

Yet, most crafters do not specialize so far. They pick one or two areas to hone. Just focus on the aspects of the profession that you truly enjoy.
Yes?

Ah, yes? Yes he did.

I put out my request as a public order and he happened to pick it up. So what?

Is that so? And why should I trust him?

Why not just place a public crafting order?
While I dislike waiting on the caprice and vagaries of public orders, I very much doubt that he would answer my beck and call, night and day. He has a life too, you know.

I do appreciate reliability...

But why him? His prices are no better than anyone else's.
What else do you have to say about Miguel?
While I do not disagree with you, there is more to a business relationship than finding one's partner attractive.

Befriend my craftsman?

Well... it's not the most outrageous suggestion anyone has ever provided.

Yes, I suppose I could send him the occasional mail, perhaps invite him to my next adventure should my guild find themselves absent an ally.

I am intrigued, if you have more to say about this partnership.
I strongly doubt that. What, do you expect him to join the guild of every customer he has?

I can? Well now, why didn't you start with that?!

Being able to demand high quality goods... that gives me such power!

And here I was begging crafters in my remarks to please craft my item well, when I could simply ask someone directly to craft the quality I need!

Alright, you've convinced me. I shall send my crafting orders directly to Mr. Bright from now on.
Have you spoken to my customer?

Wonderful!

You know, $p, there is a secret to how I am able to make such high-quality items for my customers with consistency, and for your efforts, I will share this knowledge with you.

The trick to high-quality craftsmanship is using finishing reagents.

When I need to make something exceptional, I use my finishing reagents to aid my skill in crafting. Of course, in most cases you need to specialize to use them.

Here, I have some extras. Please take them as a token of my gratitude.
These other clans aren't worthy of your time, great king!
The Mogu cannot reclaim our rightful glory without our clan's strength!

Text1_lang: The Nokhud centaur attacked Clan Shikaar's lands while our backs were turned. Help us strike back against them and their vile Primalist allies!
The spirits of this place have been disturbed! We must help them return to their rest.

Text_lang: Good soup takes time, patience, and many, many fish.
You'll spoil the broth!!
Text1_lang: You'll spoil the broth!!

Big Kinook runs an impressive kitchen. The way he commands such a large operation is truly impressive. I doubt I would have the attention or patience to welcome so many "helpers" to my hearth.

I think they could use a little more meat, though. And much, much more spice.

Text_lang: Looking for Tuukanit? He's right inside this tent, studying with the chieftain.
I can instruct you in leatherworking.  Interested?
Text1_lang: I can instruct you in leatherworking.  Interested?

Text_lang: I can instruct you in skinning and how to gather skins of higher quality. Interested?
Text1_lang: I can instruct you in skinning and how to gather skins of higher quality. Interested?

Text_lang: <A variety of materials including thread, oils, and dyes rest upon the surface of the tool bench.>
<Magical foci and mystical tomes rest upon the lectern.>
<A loom, mannequin, and drafting papers are spread across the surface of this work table.>
We will push ahead and give cover. Set up a camp so we can launch our assault.
Pushovers! Take out the lieutenants, and the rest will crumble.
They're trying to keep us out with fire? Hah! Show them we dragons bring the heat!
The djaradin are retreating. We will hold the field! Get in that fort and clear out any stragglers.
And with that, you have given us back our home. Thank you.

You looking to craft something?

The expedition's artisans have already designed a heap of new schematics, recipes, and patterns using the plentiful resources of these isles.

Just say what you're looking for.
There's just so much research to be done!
Text1_lang: There's just so much research to be done!

Every artifact reveals to us a hidden piece of this land's great history.

And there is so much we have yet to learn. Have you found anything worth studying lately?

Text_lang:
<Head Chef Stacks greets you with a hearty clang of an oven door and some enthusiastic spatula-waving.

Or at least, you're pretty sure it's a greeting.>

Text1_lang:
Are ya looking to submit or withdraw an artifact today?

Maybe you're more interested in the benefits of joining our expedition. Membership has its privileges! For one thing, ya get to work with me!
Raszageth's storm has abated. It is time to return to the Forbidden Reach and search for survivors... and seek answers about the dracthyr's past.

Text_lang: I can instruct you in tailoring.  Interested?
Text1_lang: I can instruct you in tailoring.  Interested?

Text_lang: I can instruct you in enchanting.  Interested?
Text1_lang: I can instruct you in enchanting.  Interested?

Text_lang: Have you come to prove your prowess to the Shikaar?

Text1_lang: Some of the Shikaar have been injured! Rally them to fight again!
This group of angry beasts cannot be calmed! Cut them down!
Our surveyors spotted something that might be of interest to our research. I trust you brought your climbing gear?
Oh father, I would swear you care more for the dead than the living most days...

Text_lang: The dead tell far more interesting stories, my dear... And never ask to "borrow" my hats!

Text1_lang: Stop worrying, father. Lil' Poshy will bring back your hat eventually!
%s laughs heartily.

Text_lang: Do you require assistance?

Text1_lang: A magnificent find! I will bring these materials back to our camp.

Text_lang: I wonder if there's anything this healer isn't good at!
Sure! Choosing which group to be in!

Oh! A dragonrider! Welcome to the Wild Preserve Circuit! 

It's good to see an explorer out here off the well-trodden path... This course is a little tucked away but has some very scenic dips and dives.

I think of it as a "hidden gem."

Would you like to try this course?
Text1_lang:
Oh! A dragonrider! Welcome to the Wild Preserve Circuit! 

It's good to see an explorer out here off the well-trodden path... This course is a little tucked away but has some very scenic dips and dives.

I think of it as a "hidden gem."

Would you like to try this course?

Text_lang: Ye fancy a pet battle? You'll not find me an easy opponent.

Greetings, dragonrider.

Welcome to the Caverns Criss-cross!

This course takes you through the Chittering Caverns and gnoll lands before winding its way back to Drake Grotto.

The Criss-cross has many switchbacks and tight turns, so hold on tight to your drake!

Would you like to try this course?
Text1_lang:
Greetings, dragonrider.

Welcome to the Caverns Criss-cross!

This course takes you through the Chittering Caverns and gnoll lands before winding its way back to Drake Grotto.

The Criss-cross has many switchbacks and tight turns, so hold on tight to your drake!

Would you like to try this course?

Text_lang: Broken by the swarm, the mortal races and their allies risked losing all. In their desperation, they called to the bronze dragonflight for aid, but we did not come... at first.
Uncovered by the foolish Valstann Staghelm, the swarm of Ahn'Qiraj was unleashed. It would be some time later we would learn these insects were merely tools of a long imprisoned Old God.
It was almost too late when the Qiraji began to storm the Caverns of Time themselves! It was clear our failure to heed the mortal warnings now risked our own doom.
These other clans are nothing!
These pathetic clans are beneath you, my king. They sully the great legacy of our people!
Are you lost, $r?
Text1_lang: Are you lost, $r?

Text_lang:
Need repairs? I'm your lad.

Or feel free to check my wares if you're a fellow smithy!
Text1_lang:
Need repairs? I'm your lad.

Or feel free to check my wares if you're a fellow smithy!

Text_lang: I can instruct you in engineering.  Interested?
Text1_lang: I can instruct you in engineering.  Interested?

Text_lang: <Numerous mechanical contraptions populate the workbench.>
We are the greatest!
In our hubris, we withheld our support, claiming we do not interfere in the path of mortals.

Together, we crushed the qiraji and forced them within the gates of their ancient tomb: Ahn'Qiraj. There they remained for nearly a millennia until the gates fell again, but that is a different story for a different time.
Elementals are wreaking havoc on the wetlands. Dispatch them, and rescue the creatures they've harmed.
But you aren't. You're a night elf.
I've known you for years! You are definitely a night elf! You aren't a dwarf!
Who brought the potions?

Text1_lang: Ew, I'm not healing you. I don't heal dwarves.

Text_lang: Wow, Rugan, you keep talking about dwarves. Is there something you want to tell us?
Speak for yourself, I might be a dwarf.
Why do we need potions? Diani is going to heal us.
Now now, let's all calm down. It's not Rugan's fault he hates dwarves.
I hate you guys so much.
What? I'm not a dwarf. None of us are dwarves! What do you have against dwarves?
I might not be. I might be a dwarf disguised as a night elf.
Yeah? What do you have against dwarves?

Text1_lang: Aww, we love you too.

Text_lang: I don't hate dwarves! Diani is the one who said she doesn't heal dwarves!
I do hope that you are not afraid of heights.

Welcome to the Mirror of the Sky Dash, dragonrider!

This course's rings take you up and around a placid lake.

But this "dash" course is anything but placid. Lead your drake through the course's rings in any order.

Choose the route that suits you or gives you the fastest time.

Would you like to try this dash course?
Text1_lang:
Welcome to the Mirror of the Sky Dash, dragonrider!

This course's rings take you up and around a placid lake.

But this "dash" course is anything but placid. Lead your drake through the course's rings in any order.

Choose the route that suits you or gives you the fastest time.

Would you like to try this dash course?
%s looks around cautiously.
And here we go!
The river is beautiful but the surroundings may be deadly.
I bet you shot some amazing photographs! Let's head back.
Oh these pictures are precious. Thank you so much!

Text_lang: Good day being with da trees!

Dat thing?

Check it out, I improved de quality of my necklace. Some kind of magic, I'm chopping much stronger now!

Dat's what I'm sayin'!

Now that the Artisan's Consortium is here, my old things are not gonna be worthless, I can just get them recrafted!
Ye need summat? I'm workin'!

Yer with them, are ye? It's great!

Look, my armor was fine before, but I told 'em I can't work fast enough. I need armor that keeps me hasty, not whatever my armor was doing for me before.

They swapped somethin' for me and now I swing like a starvin' wolf! Har, har!

Aye, or something like that, don't know what they did exactly, all I know is it works great now.

Ye lookin' fer a review or summat? I'd give 'em me best.

Text1_lang:
Oh no, no, no! That's terrible!

<Azley pauses for a moment in mourning, then seems to be thinking about what to do with the armor.>

Go show this to Mahra Treebender, she'll know what to do.
Hello!

Text_lang: Please, allow me to help.

Text1_lang: A wild creature stalks this land. Come, join the hunt. Prove your skill!

Text_lang: Why didn't that mage put intellect on his weapon?
Because he didn't want it to be smarter than he was!
Uncle Gao, this brewery was left in your care! What have you done?
You again! Don't you see? I have made a name for myself at last: I have brewed perfection!
At what cost? The Brewery is trashed! Infested!
Details, details.

Welcome to the Azure Span Sprint, dragonrider.

This course takes a looping route through some of the most the beautiful--and ancient--forests here in the Azure Span.

Would you like to try it?
Text1_lang:
Welcome to the Azure Span Sprint, dragonrider.

This course takes a looping route through some of the most the beautiful--and ancient--forests here in the Azure Span.

Would you like to try it?
These gnolls stole a magical artifact, help me get it back!

Text_lang: The beauty of the Azure Span must be shared with my fans... and others around the world! Think you can capture the majesty, friend?

Text1_lang: We just have a few drops on this ride but this scenery is magnificent.
%s looks at you nervously.
If you've ridden on the back of a dragon, this ride should be easy...
Nice work! Wulferd is going to love these pictures.

Text_lang: Wonderful! These images will delight and amaze all who gaze upon them!
HAHAHA!!

Text1_lang: At Algeth'ar Academy we believe in teaching by example. Please show these students how it is done.
Another A plus performance from my favorite student.

Text_lang:
Hmm... If I mix some pale with a stou...

Oh, yes. Hello!
The eternal fire will never be extinguished.
The lesson of true wisdom lies within you dear heroes, and in the choices you make. When faced with overwhelming darkness, will you make the right decisions?
The trial begins!
Your wisdom has seen you through this trial. May it ever light your way out of dark places.
Rrrraaaaghhhh!!

Text1_lang: <The ohuna watches you steadily.>

Text_lang: I hold some of the emperor's most prized possessions. Should you wish to curry favor with Shaohao, you may aid us by driving back the Ordon yaungol that seek to overtake the Celestial Court.
Text1_lang: I hold some of the emperor's most prized possessions. Should you wish to curry favor with Shaohao, you may aid us by driving back the Ordon yaungol that seek to overtake the Celestial Court.

Text_lang: $n, over here.

Text1_lang: Varian sent you as well? I'm outnumbered in my own city!$b$b<Jaina's eyes flash mischievously.>$b$bLet's go about this a different way. Put yourself in my shoes. Imagine that YOU are the leader of the Kirin Tor. $p! The most influential archmage in all of Azeroth!$b$bWhat would YOU do?

Spoken like a stalwart Alliance $c! Believe me, I understand the sentiment.$b$bNow then, as leader of the Kirin Tor and a faithful part of the Alliance, what would you do about the Sunreavers? True, they are advocates of the Horde. But they have been allies and productive members of the Kirin Tor for over 2000 years. This city is their home.$b$BWould you expel them?

<Jaina's eyes grow sad.>$b$bSo... you would purge the city? Cast the Sunreavers from their homes? The very same Sunreavers who helped humans discover magic in the first place?$b$bYou and I are obviously very different. I suppose I see my role - and the mission of the Kirin Tor - a little differently. My mind is set. Would you like to hear what I think?

Text_lang: My wrath flows freely!
Can you believe those Reliquary blood elves beat us here? We can't let them go on excavatin' our artifacts!

Text1_lang: Oh, are ye one o' Brann's friends? Betcha didn't know that back in archaeology school, he used to copy MY notes!
Any report from Lion's Landing, $c?

Back at the barracks, I heard murmurings of this "sha."$B$BYou should have heard the crazy stories - sha possessing our strongest troops? Simply tales to scare children.$B$BThe sha are nothing that I and my sisters cannot handle.
We must prevent the Horde from taking Pandaria... but we must also work to minimize suffering as we do.

Text_lang: Garrosh is going to try to use the Divine Bell to wreak havoc on the land. We must find a way to stop him.

Text1_lang: Hilda's left all the documentin' to me. Ye know that fer every artifact we find, I've got six forms ta fill out? Whaddaya we need all these forms fer, I ask!?

As if I ain't got enough on me hands, those dwarves at the mines've gotten all crazy recently about some new drink called kafa.$B$BThey're insistin' I bring 'em fresh cups o' kafa every mornin'!$B$BDo they know wot I 'ave ta do to get those kafa beans? Honestly!

I have a bad feeling about the mogu's presence.$B$BThere can only be one reason why they're excavating these mogu artifacts, and it's not for knowledge.$B$BThey're looking for clues to the mogu's power.
Stay vigilant, hero. This place has been sealed for centuries. Who knows what we will encounter within.

Text_lang: Light... I see... light. Finally, after centuries of silence, someone comes at last.
I have kept the Bell safe as promised, Master.
Wait... you are not mogu! Intruders!
Guardians, awaken! Destroy those who would steal the Thunder King's treasure!

Text1_lang: What was that thing? No matter. We will strike down any who stand in our way.
There it is, hero! The Divine Bell!
We must take it somewhere safe. Sentinels! Let's get to work.

Text_lang: Gather 'round and witness mystical wonders like you've never seen before!
What're ye lookin' at? Is it m'shoes?

Text1_lang: A powerful adversary has been spotted nearby. Act swiftly, champion!
Your actions have saved countless lives. Thank you.

From these shores, you may gaze upon Teldrassil. Once a cradle of life, it is now a ruin of ash and fire.

Even the World Trees must bow to the cycle of life. Everything born will die.

No one understands this better than the Bronze Dragonflight.

Would you like to see the tree as it once was?
The Hippogryph is a noble beast, proud and swift.  They are an honor to train, and can quickly take their rider a great distance.
No, no, no! The Bell!
Hello, $n.
Come with me.
I had Darnassus LOCKED DOWN! Every fumbling rogue that tried to sneak into the city, I CAUGHT them! I snatched every two-bit charlatan that attempted to teleport through my traps!
They couldn't possibly have gotten through... this was an inside job. Somebody inside the city has the Bell, unless... no...
These portals connect to Dalaran. That means the Kirin Tor... MY OWN Kirin Tor... helped the Horde commit this atrocity.
I will NOT be betrayed again! Those responsible for this will be punished!
Aethas Sunreaver!

I have long waited for an opportunity to deal with the Sunreavers. I asked my late husband to remove them from the city, but he believed too firmly in the neutrality of the Kirin Tor.$b$bHe was wise, but he was short-sighted. This has always been the destiny of the Kirin Tor: to serve the Alliance.
You've betrayed the Kirin Tor, Sunreaver. You've allowed Garrosh to move his forces through MY city.

Text_lang: You have it all wrong, Jaina. I did nothing.

Text1_lang: You looked the other way. You and your insubordinate kind are no longer welcome here.

Text_lang: This is OUR city too, Proudmoore.

Text1_lang: Hah! I see. I will remove the Sunreavers by force, then.
You had your chance to run.
Did you think your actions would have no consequence?

Text_lang: Free! Free at last after ten thousand years! This a happy day! Very happy happy day! Gonna need biggest party ever! With nibs! And dibs! And brews! And jungle hozen! And mountain hozen! And sky hozen!
Ha! Didn't expect to see me here did you? The Monkey King does not delegate duelery! Now, are you hero? Or are you wikket?
In pieces three the mallet be. Handle, head and ointment. You ring the bell without the mallet? You going to get an ear and face full of evil.

No! Monkey King no take rod! You no take rod! This not even real Monkey King.$b$bChief Ingoo Ingoo have rod from father Ingoo Ingoo, and his father before him, and his father before him.$b$bMonkey King give rod to my family in long long ago time. My family becomes chiefs.$b$bNo hozen live that long! None!
Poor Chief Ingoo Ingoo. His family forget what rod was for. He so mad.$b$bIf he keeps, he will corrupt his people. Very sad.

Fluffy wikkets stole the mallet head! Kunzen hozen lost it many years ago. Now the fluffy wikkets hide inside their lair and worship the head like it some kind of fancy shmancy carrot.$b$bBe careful, those fluffy wikkets bite hard.
I heard from the others... you need a kite to the wall?

Text1_lang: Ooof! Well I sure am in a tizzy today. Got eighty irons in tha fire just abouts!

Text_lang: We are the HORDE. We are slaves to nothing and no one!
With the Divine Bell, I will burn away any remnants of weakness within us. Fear... despair... hatred... doubt. The lesser races are buried beneath their weight. But WE will control their power.
Together, we will destroy the Alliance and claim what is rightfully ours. Let our song of victory begin.
This is but a test of our strength. We will pass this trial, just as we have passed others!
Stop, Garrosh! You do not know what that bell is capable of!
Ahahahaha... so in the end, it is not Varian, but his whelp who comes to face me. You run bravely to your death, young one.
I will not let you do this. I swear to it.
Stop me then, human.
Auuugh... Auuuuuugggghhhhh! This pain! I cannot control it!
Warchief! I... I have failed you.
Fight the sha - master it! Use it!
Yes, Ishi. You have.
Your Alliance must be at its end if you're sending your children against me.
I will let you live so that you can tell your King of the price for his continued defiance!

Text1_lang: A new land overrun by evil horrors of this world. A new place for us to save.
Enemies litter this isle, both old and new. We will not gain a foot of ground here without spilling blood for it.
We'll see if you revel so much in death once I've ripped out your throat!

Text_lang: The doctor is in!
Time for a little open-heart surgery!
Spurts of crimson!
Text1_lang: Spurts of crimson!

Text_lang: Donate...my body...to science...
That last shaman really knew his place!
And where is that?
Outland!
That last priest had me smitten!

At first, you will only gather normal quality reagents |A:Professions-Icon-Quality-Tier1-Small:20:20|a. As you advance your skill in gathering, you will start to find higher quality |A:Professions-Icon-Quality-Tier2-Small:20:20|a, and eventually the best quality |A:Professions-Icon-Quality-Tier3-Small:20:20|a materials.

Increase your gathering skill to find higher quality reagents.
Text1_lang:
At first, you will only gather normal quality reagents |A:Professions-Icon-Quality-Tier1-Small:20:20|a. As you advance your skill in gathering, you will start to find higher quality |A:Professions-Icon-Quality-Tier2-Small:20:20|a, and eventually the best quality |A:Professions-Icon-Quality-Tier3-Small:20:20|a materials.

Increase your gathering skill to find higher quality reagents.

Text_lang:
Very good. I knew I could trust you, $p.

There are many ways to hone your craft in specialization. Sometimes you will gain insight from questing to help others, or discovering the wonders of the world, or even by accomplishing great feats and achievements.

One reliable way to practice your craft is to make something for the first time; this will always grant specialized knowledge. Another is to study the Draconic Treatises of your profession. Reading these treatises written by skilled scribes will surely lend insights.

Have you any further questions?
And our fighters finish their match handily. I think our djaradin friend needs to go back to the training regimens.
Snail slime! One of the best smellies! But the snailettes are a bit stingy. Luckily, we niffen have a special way of gathering some.
My goblin cohorts are, uh, really excited for the explosive potential of guanite. If you see any shalewings, they seem to, uh, deposit the stuff.

Want a change of scenery and, uh, smell?

Try the Sulfur Sprint! This fast course takes you through the, um, odiferous Sulfur Wastes!

It's a great course for people who love the color green and have... no sense of smell!

All joking aside, it's a brisk course and it takes you also over and around some of the beautiful lava flows here as well.

Want to try it?
Text1_lang:
Want a change of scenery and, uh, smell?

Try the Sulfur Sprint! This fast course takes you through the, um, odiferous Sulfur Wastes!

It's a great course for people who love the color green and have... no sense of smell!

All joking aside, it's a brisk course and it takes you also over and around some of the beautiful lava flows here as well.

Want to try it?

Text_lang: I love digging up new parts to tinker with!
What's up?

Text1_lang: Greetings, mortal.
You have proven yourself worthy.
And with that, my purpose is at an end. Though if you should ever need my assistance, you may call upon me directly.

Other opportunities to obtain a Bottled Essence will arise from time to time. They may be found by defeating powerful and unique enemies roaming the Dragon Isles, as well as completing dungeons, raids and scenarios.

You may even find one in a treasure, weekly reward chest or from fighting others on battlegrounds or in arenas.

Whatever you choose, I have no doubt you will be successful in your efforts.
I am the blade of the Light.

Text_lang: $n, there is an urgent mission that requires a seasoned hero of Stormwind, such as yourself. Quickly, meet me behind Stormwind Keep, and tell no one!

Text1_lang: The Light guides my sword!

Text_lang: At your service.
The Hand of Argus stands with you.
Sound effect for troops
Sound effect for troops
Text1_lang: Sound effect for troops

Text_lang: Welcome to the Dragon Isles, explorers!

Text1_lang: Salutations! How can I help you?
I suppose I will do this... for you.

Text_lang: My blades are ready!

Text1_lang: We are all that stands between the legion and annihilation.

Text_lang: Sound effect for troops
Text1_lang: Sound effect for troops

Text_lang: Sound effect for troops
The Illidari cannot be stopped!
Together, we can defeat the Burning Legion.

Text1_lang: It will be my pleasure.

Text_lang: Death to the Legion.

Text1_lang: Your wish is my command.
Lord Illidan knows the way.

Text_lang: Pay up, they made it through those alementals!
Double or nothing on the next group?

Text1_lang: You've earned my trust hero. Simply place my staff on the Thunder King's dais and it will do the rest. You are very brave to take this mission on; good luck!

Text_lang: I am born of thunder!
Text1_lang: I am born of thunder!

Text_lang: Can you feel a chill wind blow? The storm is coming...
Text1_lang: Can you feel a chill wind blow? The storm is coming...

Text_lang: I am but...the darkness...before the storm...
Text1_lang: I am but...the darkness...before the storm...

Text_lang: Da Thunder King give me power! Come, I show you!
I must break you.
How you beat me?
Welcome, weaklings, to the rebirth of the Zandalari Empire!
Text1_lang: Welcome, weaklings, to the rebirth of the Zandalari Empire!

Text_lang: The tribes have assembled - ye face not one force, but the combined might of all of the troll empire! The hand of Zul will span all the continents of Azeroth once again! An ye lesser races will know pain!
Text1_lang: The tribes have assembled - ye face not one force, but the combined might of all of the troll empire! The hand of Zul will span all the continents of Azeroth once again! An ye lesser races will know pain!

Text_lang: Now, witness the true might of the Beast Ward. D'akala di'chuka HORRIDON! Kalimaste!
Text1_lang: Now, witness the true might of the Beast Ward. D'akala di'chuka HORRIDON! Kalimaste!

Text_lang: Hahaha! Now it be my turn! Ye gonna see what it means to be a War-God!
Text1_lang: Hahaha! Now it be my turn! Ye gonna see what it means to be a War-God!

Text_lang: Des fools thought they beat me once before. Dey only make me stronger. Now we show dem da true power of the Zandalari!
Da Zandalari cannot be stopped!
Wit de Thunder King's power de Zandalari will be reborn!
Lei Shen let us prove ta ya the might of the Zandalari. We will crush des intruders where dey stand!
We will never fail ya!
Witness de power of de spiritbinder!
I return... to... da... sands...
Da... empire... can't... fall...
Da thunder king... promised...

Text1_lang: Shadra... save... me...

Text_lang: You have swept the filth from my doorstep. Perhaps you are worthy of my attention.
But your trespass ends here. None may enter my forbidden stronghold. I shall rebuild this bridge with your bones for bricks.
Thousands of years ... without new playthings ... I will enjoy this.
Behold the power of the void.
I ... welcome ... the void's ... embrace.
Your flesh, yes yes, so perfect, GIVE IT TO US!
Text1_lang: Your flesh, yes yes, so perfect, GIVE IT TO US!

Text_lang: Again...we are torn apart...again...to the cold darkness...
Text1_lang: Again...we are torn apart...again...to the cold darkness...

Text_lang: Stop them! The Animus must not be disturbed!
The power... It cannot be wielded this way! You tempt forces you do not understand!
You have doomed yourselves. It... is... unleashed.
Stare into the face of true power!
More... training...

Text1_lang: More kindling for the flame! Come, Lu'lin... let us burn them to ash!
I can see the light.

Text_lang: You! You have earned my ire. I will make an example of you, such that all who look upon my might will tremble and submit.
The Displacement Pad appears to be active and stable.
Text1_lang: The Displacement Pad appears to be active and stable.

Text_lang: I am Lei Shen, slayer of kings and gods. You have made a grave mistake.
You would challenge me in my own sanctum? Witness your folly!
Bah! I will crush you myself. Let us see how you fare against Lightning.
I sought only to finish... the work of the Gods...
For millennia I have waited in darkness, in silence pierced only by the shrieks of the tormented, my dreams a waking nightmare.
I see the naive hope in your eyes. You... think you are my saviors? Wring that mocking pity from your hearts and focus it inwards, for you shall soon know my agony.
This twisted world is beyond redemption, beyond the reach of deluded heroes. The only answer to corruption is destruction. And that begins... now.
When I am finished with you, I shall not rest until this world is cleansed. Now perish!
Wait! I am... I am not your enemy. You are powerful. More powerful than he was, even.... Perhaps you are right. Perhaps there is still hope.

Text1_lang: You did it! Incredible! Pandaren Lorewalkers will be telling your story for generations!
I can feel it ... the Thunder King's power courses through my staff.
Best of all, you've forever disabled his infernal machine, leaving nothing for the Horde to claim as their own.

Text_lang:
Welcome, traveler! What do you need?

Ya know, Morqut Village was here before the storms, before Raszageth returned. The tuskarr fished here for generations. Even built that dock over there! It's sturdy!

Then all that unpleasantness happened and the villagers had to flee. Storms tore down what they had built up. But now they have new friends and neighbors: dracthyr, Horde, and Alliance. Makes me feel all warm inside when I think about everyone sitting around the same cooking pot, sharing soup and stories.

Text1_lang:
You may speak, outsider.

Before you ask: yes, the Reach is far from the Ohn'ahran Plains. The Horde, the Alliance, the dracthyr... they were all there for us when we needed help against Balakar Khan. We stood together against the Primalists.

Now the dracthyr have a chance to rediscover their past. Civil war has spread through these lands, just as it did through ours. I will do my part to help.

Text_lang:
Ah, a dragon racer!

It's nice to see someone attempt this remote course!

The Morqut Ascent takes you down to the coast of Morqut Islet then soaring back to its peaks!

Keep an eye out for quaint villages and remnants of the Isles' ancient past!

Would you like to try this course?
Text1_lang:
Ah, a dragon racer!

It's nice to see someone attempt this remote course!

The Morqut Ascent takes you down to the coast of Morqut Islet then soaring back to its peaks!

Keep an eye out for quaint villages and remnants of the Isles' ancient past!

Would you like to try this course?
The elements are weakening. Now is the time to strike! Finish off this storm!
It is done! That should slow them down. Excellent work!

Text_lang:
Be careful if you enter the Support Creche. We haven't been able to clear out the gasses yet.

Take an antidote with you if you insist on going inside.
Text1_lang:
Be careful if you enter the Support Creche. We haven't been able to clear out the gasses yet.

Take an antidote with you if you insist on going inside.
Those wounded dracthyr will appreciate your help. And we desperately need reinforcements.

Text_lang: Don't mind us, stranger. We only just returned, and we have a lot to rebuild.

Hello, dragon racer!

Would you and your dragon like to do some cruising?

I'll be your CRUISE director as you climb to CRUISE altitude and enjoy Aerie Chasm's sights on Aerie Chasm Cruise!

But don't let the name fool you. This is not smooth sailing! There are twists, turns, and drops all along the course, so make sure you don't go OVERBOARD!

Would you like to embark on this course?
Text1_lang:
Hello, dragon racer!

Would you and your dragon like to do some cruising?

I'll be your CRUISE director as you climb to CRUISE altitude and enjoy Aerie Chasm's sights on Aerie Chasm Cruise!

But don't let the name fool you. This is not smooth sailing! There are twists, turns, and drops all along the course, so make sure you don't go OVERBOARD!

Would you like to embark on this course?

Text_lang:
Greetings, dragon racer!

This race is called the Caldera Coaster. On this course, you'll fly around, up and over the Caldera of the Menders.

It's a steep climb up to the caldera, but flying sure beats taking the stairs!

Would you like to try the Caldera Coaster?
Text1_lang:
Greetings, dragon racer!

This race is called the Caldera Coaster. On this course, you'll fly around, up and over the Caldera of the Menders.

It's a steep climb up to the caldera, but flying sure beats taking the stairs!

Would you like to try the Caldera Coaster?
I hope you came prepared. I expect many dangers here.

Text_lang: The island has many secrets beneath the surface I aim to discover them all.

Text1_lang: Who are these guys?

Text_lang: I deal in redemption. And I look forward to... redeeming... the bodies of you and your friends.
Please. I consider myself to be an enterprising opportunist! I prefer the word "resurrectionist."
They're up to no good. Anyone who has ever buried a loved one in Tiragarde knows these guys.

Text1_lang: Grave robbers?

Text_lang: No it is Vault Urrrr... you drag out the last letter.

Text1_lang: It's Vault Uuuur!
You are definitely wrong.
It's a silly name.

Text_lang:
<You aren't able to make out many details in this book, as it appears someone has slashed claws through it.

The shreds of paper you can read feature neat handwriting, but you cannot make out the details beyond scattered words.>
Text1_lang:
<You aren't able to make out many details in this book, as it appears someone has slashed claws through it.

The shreds of paper you can read feature neat handwriting, but you cannot make out the details beyond scattered words.>

Text_lang:
<This book appears to be a list of names, the first few names are written with a very neat handwriting. As they go on, the handwriting becomes more erratic. It is clear that they have been written with different ink, as though someone wrote down one or two names at a time.

The order of the names appears to have no method to it, and the majority appear to be draconic in nature. A few have lines drawn through them.

You do notice some familiar names in the book: Alexstrasza, Nozdormu, Malygos, and Ysera. These do not have lines through them and are not written next to each other.

The purpose of the book is unclear.>
Text1_lang:
<This book appears to be a list of names, the first few names are written with a very neat handwriting. As they go on, the handwriting becomes more erratic. It is clear that they have been written with different ink, as though someone wrote down one or two names at a time.

The order of the names appears to have no method to it, and the majority appear to be draconic in nature. A few have lines drawn through them.

You do notice some familiar names in the book: Alexstrasza, Nozdormu, Malygos, and Ysera. These do not have lines through them and are not written next to each other.

The purpose of the book is unclear.>

Never doubt the bond of the earth.

It is steadfast and supports us in all our actions.

We're hard at work here.

We won't stop until every dracthyr has a chance at a new future.

One can achieve incredible things with the aid of the elements. 

In other words, Oretz smashed the doors down!

Text_lang: You look very, uh... large and unique! Maybe you can help us unload the boats?
Cooking is a little like alchemy! Who knew?
Text1_lang: Cooking is a little like alchemy! Who knew?

Text_lang: More trespassers? I will not allow you through!
Order will overwhelm you.
I will not let you through!
My sacrifice will keep these halls safe!
A small victory, I will eliminate you!
Tyr... Forgive me... I could not... stop... them...

Text1_lang: Even the memories of you will be cinders!

Text_lang: The winds are always in my favor!

Text1_lang: We'll build a new world free from their corruption!
Let me show ya the power of the elements!
Ya gonna catch ya death!
Nothing... can stop... us...
Fools! Do you not see what that wretch Tyr has done?
The elemental... will cleanse... the waters...

Text_lang: The island is rich with resources we can use, but gathering them takes time. For now, I can only offer a few provisions.
Text1_lang: The island is rich with resources we can use, but gathering them takes time. For now, I can only offer a few provisions.
There is so much to learn from this world. Have you found anything interesting?

Text_lang:
Fascinating! A mortal with a sure grasp of magic!

I can teach you to construct portals to this place if you are up for the challenge.
Text1_lang:
Fascinating! A mortal with a sure grasp of magic!

I can teach you to construct portals to this place if you are up for the challenge.

Can I help you, uplander? I'm pretty busy trying to decipher all these texts!

How do you read such tiny writing? Chiseled marks in stone are much more efficient, tactile and legible!
And since I can finally sniff out all these scrolls and tomes, I have much to do! Go on now--and thank you!
My goodness, this is quite scandalous! Oh! She did not say that!
Paper! Ink! Bah--it's no good to us niffen! Our eyesight is poor. We need texture to feel!
We've dug up more than one of these "texts" that come from the surface--ink on paper.
I don't know what they were thinking... but I'm going to do something about it!
I call it Scridorsa's Smell-o-vision! The words now each have their own distinct smells!
If I combine this empowered rune with this glass, and throw this magic pigment on here...
SMELLIFICATION!

Text_lang:
Greetings, friend! Dustmonger and Sparklefinger at your service!

Can I interest you in some magic?
OUCH!
Becoming a Sparklefinger is dangerous work! Fizzal is learning that first hand.
And there's some left for you, too, $n! Be safe out there!
Come over here, apprentice! I'm going to combine these enchantments into something that can help.
Oh! It feels so warm and cozy! I'm never taking this off.
There! Your hat now has an enchantment that should help keep your fingers safe.
You hand-led the situation excellently. Though hopefully not literally. At least not without gloves.
Rupert and Voraxian are heading back to the buried vault. But the watchers are stopping us from checking out the artifacts. Uh, help?
Oh you sweet, sweet, artifacts... so mysterious and sciencey. I want to see what you are, and if I can use your tech... Yes, I do!
Hermit Yarren could use a hand tending his fields. Why don't you and that drogbar guy help him out?
Good going, friend. Maybe I should think about getting my own drogbar assistant. Those guys are strong!

Text1_lang: Those good-for-nothings are nabbin' innocent niffen and stuffing them into cages! No respect for manners!
Thank you, $n. It's so good that you understand basic manners, like no kidnapping.
Those little crystal shardlings sure are adorable. The big ones are always stomping around making a mess of things, though. Give 'em a good thump and they'll pop right back to being cute!
Much better. They smell so much cuter and quieter!

Text_lang: That's a lot of slimes... Let's find somewhere safe to contain them before things get out of hand.
Goo-d job dealing with those escaped slimes. It looked like quite the sticky situation.

Can you take the heat? I hope so, because this race is HOT.

Why? Because the caldera is full of lava. Lava, lava everywhere!

The Caldera Cruise will take you up and down lava falls, lava pools, lava flows...

Whew! I'm sweating just thinking about it.

Do you want to sweat out this race?
Text1_lang:
Can you take the heat? I hope so, because this race is HOT.

Why? Because the caldera is full of lava. Lava, lava everywhere!

The Caldera Cruise will take you up and down lava falls, lava pools, lava flows...

Whew! I'm sweating just thinking about it.

Do you want to sweat out this race?

Text_lang: Djaradin continue to threaten our position here. The black dragonflight welcomes your help in repelling these attackers.
Though I have been perhaps... difficult at times, we've always worked together. I am sure you will continue to support my efforts, for the betterment of Azeroth.
Hold that beast still! There is no telling what this draconic tincture will do...
Intruders! Where have you come from?!
Neltharus belongs to the Qalashi now!
Finally... a test worthy of my attention.
The hunt begins!
Magma flows!
To the ground with you!
I'll have your head!
I will not be subdued!
Drown in slag!
I'll clip your wings!
Hardly a challenge.
The hunt... shames... me...
You dare interrupt my work?
A weapon wrought just for you...
Trim and punch!
Heating up fast!
Let's see what I have for you...
I'll hammer you into shape!
Vent the forge!
But... my... work...

Text1_lang: At last, Emberstoke! The forges will ring today!
Stay your hand or taste the flame!
Roast in flames!
An embarassment of riches!
Come forth and consume!
Broil!
Can't beat the heat.
Feel the burn!
Embers grow to roaring flame!
Have some trinkets...
Our fire... burns... on...

Text_lang: Sonova Snowden, specialist in furbolg language an' culture, at your service.
We would rather die than return to subjugation.
We have you pinned, Sarkareth! End this madness before more of your soldiers die.
The secrets within this crucible are ours to claim! With their power, we will never serve again!
Permission to suggest an alternate tactic?
One of these instruments could be of great service to you... though it may not distinguish between friend and foe.
But our troops are still out there!
What is this power?
During my time serving Neltharion, I assisted him in creating many... powerful elements.
In the quest to perfect Neltharion's armor, we went through many iterations.
Our lines are breaking, Sarkareth! We cannot hold them!
Do it!
Their names will ever be remembered.
This is one of our more successful attempts. While imperfect, it will be more than enough to destroy these interlopers.

Text1_lang: Your entrails will shine my armor!
Your existence ends.
Anguish and sorrow.
My beautiful armor!
Torment!
I will peel your flesh from bone!
My flesh splits, but your agony will be greater!
I... am... broken?

Text_lang: Finally, its grip weakens.
Father?
The betrayer holds no such power, my son. Sinister forces are awakening... they sense your presence.
I am but an echo. I cannot stop intruders from attempting to plunder my secrets.
Does Sarkareth wield some power that can tear at our minds?
Wrathion, I will take a contingent down these halls and root out Sarkareth. You take the other path and see what you can find.
I assume you have heard many stories of this place, and the role it played in my downfall.
Secure our perimeter!
Do not let them temper your perception.
These halls are your birthright, and the outsiders must not be allowed to take them from you.
A wise plan. I shall accompany both of you and lend what aid I can.
Within these halls I forged wonders that would shape the world.
After millennia unattended, they have become... unruly. It will take a strong will to ensure their obedience.
I... I was also a product of experimentation. One that your previous incarnation attempted to destroy.
You are of my blood. The fact you had the strength to survive proves it.
Flame and shadow, both powerful, influential forces.
Combined, they become something even greater. Learn to harness them together, and no force can oppose you.

Text1_lang: Mortal pests. Fuel for my inferno.
Wall of flame!
This plane will burn!

Text_lang: You cannot escape the dark.
Shadow and flame awaken!
Withering shade.
Blistering twilight!
Burning darkness consumes all.
I... am... eternal...
There is no denying its strength, but it seems too dangerous to truly control.
You possess the will to master it, my son. Just imagine what you could accomplish.
Do you see, now? The secrets that shadowflame holds?
We can't hold them!
Text1_lang: We can't hold them!

Text_lang: You, Wrathion, must succeed where they failed and carry on my vision.
Of course, father.
I had such high hopes for the dracthyr, but ultimately the venture was just another disappointment.
This early attempt at creating dracthyr yielded a subject too violent to control.
Yet there is value in documenting the carnage it generates.
Unfortunately they were too volatile to control. But where others see failure, I see opportunity.
You will serve nicely as new test subjects.
How exemplary. Congratulations.
It was my honor to evaluate the development of Neltharion's dracthyr.

Text1_lang: I will beat you into pulp!
I am the apex.
Shattering roar!
Bones splinter.
Break.
Crush.

Text_lang: Obviously our first prototype lacked the desired strength. The next iteration was imbued with excessive arcane power.
Toys to smash!
Carnage!
Detonate!
Heave!
Destroy!
Sadly a creature with unstable arcane surges was useless, so we refined the infusion process.
Die, lesser things!
You will be erased.
Witness my strength!
Incinerate from above!
Blasted to nothing.
I... cannot... fail...
I was afraid of this. The process used to create you weakened your spirit. An issue I doubt I'll have with my true born heir.
Your performance is beyond my expectations.
Of course! And you rose to the challenge, as I knew you would.
This all seems... questionable. How malleable is this vision of yours?
Wait. You knew these creatures were waiting to be unleashed?
Sabellian, as my blood I look to you to inherit. But know there are many who would steal your birthright.
I will not yield any ground.
Even now, djaradin forces use the chaos to launch an assault. They must be stopped.
Zaqali, take the wall!
We've slaughtered dragons. What hope did you have?
Ignara, time to feed.
The weak burn.
Text1_lang: The weak burn.

Text_lang: Break their ranks!

Text1_lang: Everywhere I look, I see something that needs cataloging. While I am busy here do you think you can document along the river?
$n, step forward! We're approaching the island.
I need everyone in top form if we're to complete this mission. Show me what you can do!
Good! Next... hm, that's odd. We weren't expecting rain...
Private Cole will run you through the rest of the drills. I need to discuss this storm with the helmsman.

Text_lang: Let's move into sparring positions. I'll let you have the first strike.
Never run from your opponent. Stand your ground and fight until the end!
Remember to always face your enemy!
I yield! Well, I'd say you're more than ready for whatever we find on that island.
Captain! We can't weather this storm for long!

Text1_lang: Everyone below decks! Now!
Murlocs are dangerous in large numbers. Take back our supplies, but avoid fighting too many of them at once.

Text_lang: Never seen a storm like that...
Nasty storm! It must'a hit the first boat, too.

Text1_lang: Don't worry, we'll find the expedition.
You three, scour the island for any sign of the expedition. $n, you and I will scout ahead.
So... hungry...
Alaria!
Henry knew... you would come...
But more than that, he's a soldier of the Alliance. We leave no one behind.
Of course I did. He's my son.
Eat first, Alaria. You need your strength.
The quilboar... ambushed us...
Recruit! Quilboar are far deadlier than murlocs. You need to be ready for the dangers ahead.
Alright, let's see what you know!
Your spells can be used at range. Cast them to start combat! Don't let the enemy start it for you.
Use Shadow Word: Pain at the start of combat. It deals damage to your foe over time.
Good! Keep using Smite while Shadow Word: Pain deals damage. Wait for the right time to use Shadow Word: Pain again.
Shadow Word: Pain is fading, cast it again!
Good, now do it again! Shadow Word: Pain will continue to damage your opponent while you assault them with Smite.
Excellent, one more time! A priest can wear down their opponents with proper use of Shadow Word: Pain.
You used Shadow Word: Pain too soon. You'll do more damage if you use it when it has almost expired.
Good. You're ready to face the quilboar. Let's get our people back.
We'll head north and rendezvous with the others. Alaria, recover your stamina before pushing forward.
I've never given up on any member of the Alliance. I'm not about to start by failing my son.
Understood. Your son was right to have faith in you.

Text_lang: Over here! The quilboar are conducting some sort of ritual...
There's a member of the expedition trapped by quilboar up ahead. Let's go over the plans to rescue him.
The geolord... will not... lose...
We gonna get power when ritual done!
New sacrifice!
Sacrifice... for... ritual...
Your blood will earn our reward!
Our tribe... will... survive...
Oh you're in for it now, pal!
Help! I'm too brilliant to die!
Intruders! You will be our next sacrifice!
I knew the Alliance would rescue us! Let's get out of here!

Text1_lang: Well, he was right. Now, where's the rest of the expedition?

Text_lang: I'm not sure, but I know how we can find out.
You're Captain Garrick! Henry's mother! He always said you'd come for us!
I brought along a miniaturized Scout-o-Matic 5000! Let's just unshrink it...
Whoops, too big! A slight adjustment, and...
There! Just right. Give it a try!

Text1_lang: It has a camera? Then why does anyone need to be up there?

Text_lang: Come in, $n! It seems the Scout-o-Matic 5000's camera is working as expected!
I mean, I doubt anything of the sort will happen. Just... don't jostle it around too much.

Text1_lang: Quiet! I see something!

Text_lang: As a backup, of course! What if the machine were to break? We wouldn't be able to see!
Or... science! The re-sizer can enlarge one of the nearby boars so it can trample all of those monsters flat!

Text1_lang: We don't have any other choice. My son's life is on the line.

Text_lang: They're bringing a dragon back from the dead?! How are we going to deal with that?

Text1_lang: We have to stop the sacrifice! But it would take an army to get through all of the undead...

Text_lang: One giant boar coming up! Let's just calibrate the re-sizer...
Whoops, too small! Let's see... turn this dial... okay, try it now!
Yikes! That won't do at all... here, try again.
Eureka! A giant boar! Let's report back to the captain.

Text1_lang: We'll deal with the army. The rest of you, push forward and set up camp once we've cleared a path.

Text_lang: Mother! I knew you'd save us!

Text1_lang: Something's happening to the boar! Hang on, $n!
We've dealt with the undead. Now let's finish off that necromancer and save my son!
Good riddance. Let's go check on Henry.

Text_lang: Greetings, friend.
Text1_lang: Greetings, friend.

Text_lang: Thank you, $p. We can't give the recruits a proper burial, but you can still perform their last rites.
All right, let's see what we can find.
Kee-La and I will scout ahead. We'll meet you to the north, just outside the harpy den.

Text1_lang: Another priest! Quickly, the spark of life has yet tae fade from these recruits!
Cast Resurrection tae bring them back from the brink o' death!
It's time fer my spirit tae move on. Light be with ye, always.

Text_lang: Good luck! Those survivors are countin' on ye!

Text1_lang: Rescue anyone you can find!

Text_lang: I will harvest your life force... and then those who sealed me in here shall burn!

Text1_lang: Is someone there? Help! Elune, guide them to me!

Text_lang: You will be kindling for the flame!
If... I die... so... do you!

Text1_lang: You saved my life! Allow me to return the favor. Hop on!
You should have known better than to say that to a druid.

Text_lang: Bah, you were just tellin' me how much you hate spiders!
$n, I can't believe it! You've saved them all!
That's Meredy, our mage. We have to rescue her!

Text1_lang: It seems the harpies are holding one of your people captive.

Text_lang:
The ogres and their allies are trying to sacrifice the rest of my expedition for some necrotic ritual.

We won't let that happen.

Text1_lang: She will be. Come on!

Text_lang: Let's deal with those harpies. I just hope Meredy is okay...
Dispel the foul magic that binds me here.
I attempted to bring an end to these rituals...
But the ogres ensnared me... drained my power...
Free me, so I might recover... and pass some of my power to you.
The spell is weakening... the Light returns to me!
Ahh, freedom! You have my gratitude.
Accept my blessing, and end the necromancy that plagues this island.
Keep fighting! I'll heal you!
We can beat it if we fight together! For the Alliance!

Text1_lang: Something huge is headed this way!
Hah! There! Come on, let's get outta here while we can!

Text_lang: Boss... counting... on me...
The captain will be thrilled! Let's get back to camp and deliver the good news.
We saved Meredy, all thanks to $n!

Text1_lang: Good work. Now get some rest. We'll find the others soon.
Recruit, you're with us. The rest of you stay here while we head for the citadel.

This will be fun, I promise! Just a little forbidden void magic mixed together with druidic components and BAM! 

I bet ye'll make a fine ogre.
If ye feel a strange tingle, that means the illusion is working!
All right, $n. Just act like an ogre and get us inside the citadel.

Text_lang: Don't use big words. In fact, don't say anything at all. Just smile and wave.

Text1_lang: Keep moving... let's see what we can learn about the ritual.

Text_lang: More sacrifices! Go to cooking pit, wave at Gor'groth. Show what you got!
What do we have here... all the sacrifices we thought we lost!
It is time to complete the ritual atop the citadel. Then all will bow before us!
Take them to the back. We'll seal them with the ward stones like we did their leader.
Captain Kelra! No, no, no... how can we break these seals?

Text1_lang: There is always a way, Henry.
Gor'groth mentioned ward stones. Find them so we can free the captain.

Text_lang: Wug!
Wug.... wug...
Invader! Me smash good!
Me... get... smash...
Boss say you too late!
We keep sacrifice, you no stop it!
Me speak... too soon...
How... me... die...

Text1_lang: Thank you for saving me... but we still need to stop Gor'groth!
Let's move. I'll draw the ogres' attacks. The rest of you focus on taking them down.
We've almost cleared the room! Keep pushing!

Text_lang: This place is full of necrotic energy... they must be close to reanimating the dragon!
That's one of Gor'groth's top lieutenants! Can we really defeat him?

Text1_lang: We haven't come this far to quit now. $n, you lead the attack. I'll charge in after you.

Text_lang: Understood, captain!

Text1_lang: I'll keep his attacks focused on me. Henry, you heal us up!

Text_lang: Me gonna smash, you no stop ritual!
Me never... see Gor'groth... win...

Text1_lang: No time to waste. We've got Gor'groth cornered!
There's Gor'groth... and the dragon he's trying to reanimate!

Text_lang: Puny vermin! You will not stop the ritual! Not after all we have done!
Ravnyr will destroy you all!

Text1_lang: Now, everyone! For the Alliance!

Text_lang: No! He's completing the ritual!
We... will be... the final sacrifice!
Nothing happened... I think we stopped it!

Text1_lang: Don't give up! We can still win!
Pathetic mortals. Your deaths will nourish me!
Foolish ogre! You have given me nowhere near enough power!
$p, speak to me when you're ready to leave the citadel. We need to find a way back to Stormwind.
We've done it! The ogres and their dragon have been defeated and the storm has cleared.

You should feel proud of yourself, $n. We all worked together to thwart the plans of an insane necromancer while rescuing a missing expedition.

Let's get out of this citadel. We need to figure out how we're going to get off this island.
Look! Alliance reinforcements!

Text_lang: There ye are! We've been tryin' tae get through the storm tae reach ye!

Text1_lang: Excellent work, $p. Hop on a gryphon and fly home to Stormwind.
It's good to be back on solid ground after so much time at sea.
Feel free to explore the city with Lindie while I report to King Wrynn. I'll send word once we have our next mission.

Text_lang: What do you need directions to?
Text1_lang: What do you need directions to?

Text_lang: There are stable masters in both Old Town and the Dwarven District.
Text1_lang: There are stable masters in both Old Town and the Dwarven District.

Text_lang: Karin can be found in easternmost Stormwind, through the gates at the back of Old Town.
Text1_lang: Karin can be found in easternmost Stormwind, through the gates at the back of Old Town.

Text_lang: Did you get directions?
It's great to be back in Stormwind!
Old Town, here we come! It's a bit of a run, so follow me and don't get lost!
Hey, $n! What's the hold up?
I am at your service, $n! How can I help you?
Let's visit a trainer to learn about specializing your skill set!
Greetings, $c. Have you come to learn about combat specializations?
Text1_lang: Greetings, $c. Have you come to learn about combat specializations?

Text_lang:
There are three specializations available to Priests: Discipline, Holy and Shadow.

Discipline Priests use magic to shield allies from taking damage as well as heal their wounds.

Holy Priests are versatile healers who can reverse damage on individuals or groups, and even heal from beyond the grave.

Shadow Priests use sinister Shadow magic and terrifying Void magic to eradicate their enemies.
Text1_lang:
There are three specializations available to Priests: Discipline, Holy and Shadow.

Discipline Priests use magic to shield allies from taking damage as well as heal their wounds.

Holy Priests are versatile healers who can reverse damage on individuals or groups, and even heal from beyond the grave.

Shadow Priests use sinister Shadow magic and terrifying Void magic to eradicate their enemies.

Text_lang: An excellent choice, indeed!
To the Pig and Whistle! The first round's on me!
The Horde raided and destroyed most of the city a number of years ago. But as you can see, it's been rebuilt good as new!
Fill yer tankard and pull up a chair. We've stories to tell and kegs to empty.
Text1_lang: Fill yer tankard and pull up a chair. We've stories to tell and kegs to empty.

Text_lang: Sorry for interrupting, $p. I have orders from Captain Garrick.
You'll be briefed when you report to Stormwind Keep.

Text1_lang:
My job is to charter flights on behalf of King Wrynn.

If you have received a special assignment on behalf of the crown, I may be able to arrange a flight for you.

Text_lang: Ah, this must be the new recruit. Welcome, $n.
It is good to hear your mission was a success, Captain.
That is why she will not be going alone.
The war against the Horde weighs heavily on my mind. What news do you bring, Spymaster?
I have received word that Horde has joined forces with the Zandalari Empire. Their naval might is now vastly increased.
Then we must make new allies of our own. Jaina, what of Kul Tiras? Their fleet is second to none on the open seas.
Can you convince them to rejoin the Alliance and add their strength to ours?
Be careful, Jaina. Light be with you.

Text1_lang: I will return with the Kul Tiran fleet... or not at all.
I must at least try. Without their support, our ships we will be no match for the combined Horde and Zandalari navies.

Text_lang: Anduin, need I remind you that Jaina is the reason Kul Tiras left the Alliance? They will never welcome her back!

Text1_lang:
Hey there, $n!

If you're here to ask about timewalking, I'm afraid you'll need to become more familiar with the present before you can visit the past.

Maybe I can send you back once you've toured the city and met with the king!

Text_lang: And so can the Alliance.
Captain Garrick speaks highly of you, $n. I am certain that Jaina can depend on you.

Text1_lang: The king has called us together. There are urgent matters that require our attention.
Stay safe out there, and always remember your training.
I know you have a bright future ahead of you, $n.
Hey there, $c! Need a lift?
Are you prepared for the journey to Kul Tiras?
I hope this works.

Text_lang: Heyyy, look who's finally awake.
Beware... beware... the daughter of the sea... hmm hmm...
All right, here's the plan:
Hit me.
AUGH! OH, YOU BRUTE!
GUARD! GUARD, HELP!! OHHH!!
Hey! What's going on in there?!
Quick! Hit that lever!
Grab your gear and let's pay the block warden a visit. We'll need his keys.
Damn! The keys are ruined. That was some serious firepower!
Just what kind of powder is this? Hey, help me grab some of this stuff.
Oh! One more thing. Well, two.
You! Stop right there!
No! Noooo!!
There she is! Let's hop in.

Text1_lang: Flynn! Over here!
You arrived with Jaina Proudmoore! You're the Alliance emissary!
What is going on in there? It sounds like you started a riot!
You're lucky he's paying you at all. Now row!

Text_lang: A new gunpowder, like nothing I've ever seen.

Text1_lang: Wait... I recognize you...

Text_lang: OH, and I rescued the target, of course. Crime-buddy, Taelia. Taelia, crime-buddy.
No idea what you're talking about... But I think we finally have some real dirt on Ashvane.
Alliance emissary?! Cyrus didn't mention that... I would have charged him double!

Text1_lang: Looks like another Alliance ship has already docked. Hopefully they got a warmer welcome than Jaina did...
Here we are, Boralus Harbor. Aside from Proudmoore Keep, it's the most heavily guarded part of the city. And the only place most visitors ever get to see.

Cyrus has raised me since I was a child. He taught me how to fight, how to ride, how to sail.$B$BBy the time I entered the guard I was already better trained than some of my instructors.$B$BThey didn't appreciate that.

Text_lang: Thanks for the lift, Tae. I'll report to the old man.

Text1_lang: I grew up hearing tales of the great kingdom of Lordaeron.$B$BAnd tales of its fall.$B$BThe Scourge took my mother, my father, and my homeland before I was even old enough to understand.
Don't worry about the prison break. Here in the market, you're just another traveler. Now let's get you settled in!
This ferry connects to stations all along the sound's interior coast.
You'll need a ferry pass from the harbormaster. That won't be a problem.

Text_lang: Looking for a ferry?
Text1_lang: Looking for a ferry?
The counting house is under heavy guard day and night. Feel free to store your valuables here.
I spend a lot of time in here, pestering travelers to tell me their stories. Especially folks from the Eastern Kingdoms!
The market hosts travelers from all over Azeroth. There are many taverns, but this one's my favorite!
Beautiful, isn't she? Cyrus gave her to me when she was just a hatchling.
Believe me, I know the feeling. We'll fly soon, all right?
Ah, there's my girl. You must be restless, being cooped up here all day.
Where ya headed?
You'll feel at home here in no time. Now let's check in with Cyrus!
Come on! The harbormaster's office is just through here.
Wait... What's going on?

Text_lang: King Greymane, it is an honor. You are free to remain in the harbor on my authority.
Taelia! Prepare a full briefing for our guests.

Text1_lang: Aye, sir!

Text_lang:
You must be the Alliance emissary. I'm glad Flynn and Taelia were able to get you out of that damn prison. 

I am Sir Cyrus Crestfall. On behalf of the Proudmoore Admiralty, I welcome you to Kul Tiras.

<Cyrus extends his massive hand warmly.>
